I have RA and can't wear any shoes for too long, but these are very comfortable. Since I wear a 10AAAA I will have a shoe repair shop trim the length of the tabs, but that is a simple thing. I expect any casual shoes to be much too wide, but these are easily adjustable thanks to the multiple Velcro tabs. The color doesn't appear clearly in the photo, but it is perfect for wearing with just about anything short of formal dress or business where sandals in general wouldn't do. These have gold flecks on a light tan background rather than being mostly gold. The fact that the soles are wide and sturdy makes them particularly appropriate for any person who has difficulty walking, but they don't appear fat and ugly once worn--unlike many sandals with rubber soles. My sister, who has no handicap and owns several Viomic shoes or sandals, advised me to get these. I strongly recommend them.

reviewText: Love these shoes!!

I would have given the shoe 5 stars except that I couldn't fasten the shoes across the instep since I had surgery on both feet and they have since broadened in that area making it very difficult to fasten any kind of shoe with a strap across the instep.  For a normal foot, they would be great because as your feet would swell during the day, they can be easily adjusted.  There just wasn't enough strap to do so for me so I had to send them back.  What a bummer as I really love the support that they give my feet normally.  Oh well, maybe the next time.

reviewText: This is a gorgeous and very effective redesign of a sandal I purchased elsewhere last year and had to return because it didn't fit snugly around the ankle, which is where I need the most support. This new design is perfect in every way: the back strap is thinner and thus more elegant, and the side strap around the ankle is likewise also thinner and has a gold-button clasp, rather than the ugly buckle clasp of the earlier model. Also, the gold-cork material is bright and cheerful, perfect for the cruise I'll be taking them on shortly. Thank you, Vionic, for creating shoes so stylish no one would ever guess they are orthotic!
They are comfortable, they fit well, and are easy to walk in with giving strappy support.

The fit is great an the support is fantastic.  I absolutely love them.

Second, the velcro just started to COME OFF the shoe after a few weeks of wearing them 3-4 days/week. I can probably just glue it back down, but it's just pretty silly.

My doctor informed me not to wear backless shoes with plantar fasciitis or achilles tendon injury (I have both). He said backless shoes cause you to grip with your toes and make the foot more painful later that day. I agree. I do have some other Vionic backless shoes that I bought prior to learning that tip but I limit them to shorter wear duration and I am fine.

reviewText: I have owned these shoes for several months and I absolutely love them. I have overpronation and these shoes offer just the right amount of arch support to correct the problem. I have ordered several pairs. They can also be used to dress up or down depending on your outfit. I highly recommend these sandals to anyone who needs stylish, but supportive sandals.

reviewText: True size and color
I'm very happy with the vionics
I like the Vionic sandals.  I have a few pair of  their sandals.  This particular pair didn't fit like my others but I will continue to buy more.

These do run large. Size 8 is larger than my usual 8.5, but arch and toe grip hit in the right place. The style is less ugly than other Vionics I looked at, with the cork shade being a pleasant neutral that won't call a lot of attention to itself. The sandals make my feet look like platters because they're made to cradle the entire foot; that's how you get the support.

Bottom line: they're not pretty but they're the only game in town. It's impossible to find supportive sandals with an open toe and a closed heel that will accept custom orthotics, so these are the best alternative if you wear orthotics and want to be able to wear sandals for any period of time. Someday, maybe some shoe company will be clever enough to make a fashionable, orthotic-friendly, supportive (not too bendy) sandal; but I won't hold my breath waiting.
summary: Not the sandals you wear to impress

reviewText: I bought these to wear on a trip to Italy because I knew we would be doing a lot of walking.  I wore them every day for the nine day trip and my feet and back were never sore.  They are nice looking shoes and went with everything I wore.  I was very pleased with their fit and functionality and will definitely buy Vionic shoes again.

Love these! I already owned the black pair. I received lots of compliments on them so I decided to get the red. Very comfortable and the arch support prevents aching feet! I have pairs of Vionic boots, shoes,  sneakers and sandals. These shoes are perfect for people who walk a lot. I am a teacher so I walk on concrete all day. If I wear non-Vionic shoes my feet and knees hurt by the end of the day. Quality is great for the money. I only throw them away when I have worn grooves off the bottom!

I love these sandals! I like that even though they are orthotic, I receive compliments on them all the time. They fit comfortably loose, might not work for very narrow feet but for my average width feet, they are great.  They are sized a little generously.  I wear a 10.5 but needed a 10.  The sole stinks VERY easily. I'm not one to sweat much but I had to scrub the sole of this sandal every week.  I bought a vegetable brush, and I would use a dot of dawn dish soap, scrub the bottom, rinse a bit, pat dry and sprinkle just a little baking soda on top and they looked and felt good as new the next day.  I wish they would fix this issue.  I don't have it with any of my other shoes or sandals, but I'm glad it's an easy fix.

My feet tend to overpronate, so I need shoes that can compensate for that and provide all-day comfort. I heard Vionic was a great option for this, and since I needed shoes for a then-upcoming vacation I decided to give these a shot. So glad I did! These are super comfortable for all day wear, and they went perfectly with all of my outfits. Regarding sizing, I'd say order a half size down from whatever shoe size you normally wear-- I'm a size ten but found the 9.5 fit perfectly, whereas the 10 was a little too large.
summary: Wonderful shoes; comfortable and great for casual style

reviewText: great sandals

I absolutely love these shoes. I was a bit skeptical when I first bought them. I wore them a few hours the first day and then gradually increased to all day. I have a job where I am on my feet all day and lately my feet, ankles, hips, and back have been hurting me. After one week with these shoes my plantar fasciitis is healing and my back pain is almost gone. I took my shoes off yesterday and put on my regular everyday flip flops and I could actually feel how my posture is changing. I am going to be buying more of these shoes and in different styles. I would highly recommend if you are having any foot, ankle, or back pain. And they are really cute shoes.

Very similar to this shoe, just made a bit nicer and out of softer material.  Both of these brands come in smaller sizes  (5 or 5.5) than what is available at The Walking Shoe Company, and are plenty wide for great stability and comfort.

The area was where the shoe bends, at the ball of the foot, when you walk and was pinching my foot every time I took a step.  Lucky for me I had Mole skin to cover the blister for the rest of the trip home.  I had to return the shoes.  I don't know if this is a defect or the shoe just hit one foot wrong but I am afraid to wear this style again.

reviewText: Actually provides the needed arch and stability I needed.

Most of the shoes I wear are Vionics these days because I have plantar fascitis. Buying shoes from Vionic has proven to be hit or miss. Some shoes have great arch support, some do not. Some shoes fit me at a size 7, some need to be a size 8. I bought these at a size 8 but I probably could have gotten a size 7. They are a bit wide for my feet and I have to adjust the straps to the tightest setting.

I wish there was more consistency in this brand when it comes to size. The size was a bit off, but I kept them as is. The big plus with these shoes is the arch support. These shoes have enough support to get the approval of my physical therapist. The support is high and it is firm. I can wear them all day at a job where I am mostly standing and not suffer later. These are my go-to shoes for work. I just wish they were cuter. They get three stars for looking kind of cheap. I am not a huge fan of the shiny patent leather look but these days comfort has been more important than looks.
summary: Great arch support but not very cute

reviewText:
I LOVE LOVE LOVE the support these sandals give. They also look quite nice. At first they were a bit tight everywhere but after a couple of days they stretched out. After a month, they were too loose!
However, I am speechless at the quality of Velcro...It literally detached after a few weeks and I had to sew them back on! Doesn't look so nice anymore. I would seriously consider returning them to the manufacturer (not Zappos) if I had bought them from Vionic itself. Velcro not just detached, it stopped holding altogether, so I needed to buy all new better Velcro. For shoes that expensive, this is absolutely unacceptable. Payless has WAY better Velcro!
I do need the arch support so I will keep looking for non-Velcro styles, as I see many people complain about the Velcro.
summary: I LOVE LOVE LOVE the support these sandals give

I have small feet (technically a size 4) with big problems.  I hadn't worn sandals for years because sandals and orthotics simply don't mix.  Then I discovered Vionics.

Because my feet are so small, I can't wear all of their styles I need styles that are adjustable across my toes, my arch and behind the heel. These are fantastic. The Velcro allows me to easily adjust each point so my feet feel secure in the sandals. Better yet, the Velcro closures blend into the design so they simply dissappear from a visual perspective. The length is a little long, but not enough to be a problem.  I could with they made size 4s, but can make the 5s work

Every time I wear them, I get compliments and the style and color work equally well with jeans, dressy pants, shorts or sundresses. I was worried the cork with gold would look garish, but it's subtle enough to work well.
summary: Great sandals - great for small feet or where you need adjustability

The shoe feels great, but the upper started falling apart right away. I have them held together with electrical tape in 4 different places, and I'm not exactly out running marathons in them, here. I'm determined to wear them all summer because they were so damn expensive but for the price, they really should have held up much better. I love vionic, nothing else works on my plantar fasciitis, but these were a disappointment.

The size I ordered was too small and the bra was not as comfortable as I would like so I probably will not order up.  I also am not certain even a larger size would give me enough cup coverage, plus I really wanted white (I react to clothing dyes) - so not the bra for me.  But I do have to say that this bra runs somewhat larger than the Hanes and Maidenform teen bras of the same size - and the cotton sure feels a lot nicer than those plastic-like fabrics most teen bras are made of.  I wish I could have found these bras when my teen daughter was younger. It is cute and offers good support for the size.  It also has a good amount of padding so it is modest and fills the cups a bit but isn't overly padded like the push-up bras. (About 1/4 to 1/2 inch padding,  so if your daughter is a young preteen you might find it adds too much shape.)  Some comments:  A previous poster suggested that size 36 = adult 36 B but I would suggest it is more like an adult  34 B.  The bra is almost exactly the same size as the old 34 B's I still have in my drawer from my skinnier days.  The cotton is fairly soft but the lace is scratchy.  I don't think it sits against the skin,but I wish they had used cotton lace.  The bra straps are bit sharp - kind of "knife-edge."  Again, I wish they had used better quality straps; personally I would be willing to pay up for better quality all around.  But for many teens this might not be an issue,  Finally, the bra I got had a slight discoloration on the strap like maybe the bra had been sitting around in a warehouse for a while.
summary: Good bra for young teen - more generous fit than most teen bras

reviewText: Great fix my daughter is happy will order more .
Love these bras for my budding teen!

A very good looking product, but the back band is very tight so put an extender on the hook side.  Wish there were more colors available.  It washes well and is comfortable, seems to me to be made just as well as Maidenform bras but Jeteway brand has slightly thicker cup padding.

Jeteway has these listed under underwear for young girls, however they are also suitable for young women. Obviously it depends on the look and the style, because they are marketed as a young, sporty, comfortable and teeny look. Not the lingerie and over-sexualized loo you often get in young girls underwear, especially in the UK.
In the UK it is often quite a task to find decent training bras, teen bras and in general a more conservative look. As the mother of 3 girls I have had plenty of experience with this kind of dilemma.
This bra (I had two of mine test drive it) is very comfortable, looks great on and fits well. As you can in the pics it is a combo of slight lingerie look, sporty and comfortable every day bra. The material is cotton and can be washed in the washing machine.
In the pics it is worn by my 22 year old, who is wearing a size 36 by Jeteway.
The company possibly needs to add a more descriptive size chart. At the moment you can order 32/34/36/38. The 36 is equivalent to female adult 36/B. If the intended market is younger girls it might be better to add cup sizes to the very exact descriptions the company has provided on the product page.
Aside from this is a very good quality piece of clothing ( I was pleasantly surprised), which comes in lovely packaging and fits superbly.
*I received a free copy of this product, courtesy of the company, for purposes of review.*
summary: Comfortable, good quality and fits well

reviewText:
When shopping online for clothing I am always afraid of what I might get.  However, when I received YogaRat Men's XrossFlex Land& Sea T-shirt I was greatly pleased with the shirt.  First off, I am right between a medium and a large, so I decided to play it safe ordered large and hope for the best. I am 5'10 and the shirt fits well.  Now I would not call this a compression shirt, but because I have fairly large arms, it was fairly tight like a compression shirt through the arms, which is what I was hoping for.  But the rest of the shirt is not compression at all, as it fits fairly loose.  The material, however, feels like the material of a compression shirt.  With my fairly broad shoulders, this shirt still fit pretty spot on for me.  The material isn't a think material, but medium weight and stretchy.  What I love is that this shirt is made for both use on land and in sea.  I sometimes wear swim shirts, as I don't like to burn at the beach.  This would definitely be a shirt I could wear that provides me with the protection I need, with a UPF of 50+.  The drawback would be wearing something long sleeve in the sun, but if I was going to be in the water most of the time, this shirt would be ideal, as it allows for all activities.  I think it is even more ideal as a base layer during the winter, or playing sports in the winter.  As it is summer right now, time will tell.  But I look forward to using it for running, during the colder months.

Pros:
-Good for use in water or on land
-Great sun protection
-Has the warmth of a compression shirt, without the tightness
-Fits well through chest, arms, and waist
-Neutral color choices available

Cons:
-The only thing I would have liked to have seen was slightly shorter arm lengths.  Because it is tight through the arms it is not bad, but about one inch less would have been ideal (again I am 5'10, so probably a better fit for most.)

I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review!
summary: Great Active Shirt for Water and Land

reviewText: We checked the size charts, measured three times, and ordered one size up, just to assure a loose fit.  Nouqi contacted us, and told us to measure again, because Asian sizes are different than American sizes.  We measured yet again, and felt the measurements were well above what we actually needed.  There was a great deal of anticipation for this costume and when my daughter attempted to put it on........the garment is 8 inches smaller than the stated size around the bust, the waist, and the hips.  From the reviews published, this is an issue the company is well aware of.  Regardless of the difference in size range, an inch is still an inch, and this garment is not as advertised.  Now, Nuoqi wants us to pay for the return postage to Texas for their mistake.  After five years, the company should have their QC under control.  Not impressed in the least.
summary: There was a great deal of anticipation for this costume and when my ...

reviewText: I recieved the costume faster than expected, which was a good thing... The skirt fit perfectly, as for the top... *sigh* on the given sizes I was supposed to be a medium... The bust said 88cm and mine was 85cm, but still it was hard to put on as the fabric is super stiff and my boobs were squished down under the looser part of the shirt. Lifting arms higher than shoulder height and deep breaths are impossible... Really sad as I had to abandon my first cosplay in order to not suffocate in it... So now I have to spend extra money for a bigger one or a binder in order to fit it. (In the pic you can't see it, but I couldn't WAIT to get out of the shirt)
The shirt was a little small. But besides that I loved it! It looks so cute.

I am 5'9 about 170lbs and I ordered the XXXL based off the sizing listed. The shirt fits just right not being too tight or too loose but if you are a little bigger I think you could still fit in it. The skirt waist was far too big for me but accurate to the sizing listed. I ordered it expecting it to be too big so it's no issue with me since I can just sew it and the length of it is good. Overall the quality of everything was good for the price and I'm happy with my purchase.

The material is okay, it's definitely not the greatest but it gets the job done and not too cheap.
And just to warn others the basics of how to order this without being disappointed:
ORDER A SIZE BIGGER THAN YOU THINK!! The sizing is pretty small, be careful!
THIS IS NOT STRETCHY AT ALL!!
TOO BIG IS BETTER THAN TOO SMALL! You can always go to a local seamstress to get it properly fit!

Great alternative to a purse. My shoulders get dislocated from heavy purses on one side (I have a small figure). This light material feels great now. I love the material, it doesn't seem cheaply made. It's the perfect size, holds the right amount. Definitely will buy more colors!
Got it as a gift, the person loves it. So many different ways to use it.

This is a really great buy in my opinion. The canvas is very thick and sturdy and the leather detailing is actual leather, which I was not expecting for under $25. The zippers and hooks are made of a metal with some heft. The bag is padded all over to keep your things from bouncing around and all the pockets are good-sized.

I bought it for short hiking trips but it is also perfectly stylish so I can even take it to work or around. It is about 11" by 9" and expands to maybe 5" or 6" deep once all the pockets are full. The straps zip together and clip onto the bag and there are three rings at the bottom of the bag so you can carry it like a backpack or a sling bag on either side. The only thing it is missing is a water pouch, I think a narrow one would fit on one side of the backpack.

I love this bag, arrived looking just like the picture. Made of nice materials, has a slight weight to it, just shows it will hold up. Only reason for the four stars is because one of the metal clasp that you use to hook in on the hoop on the back, was broke. Easily fixed with a pair of pliers. I still absolutely love it though!
Love it!
Zipper dissembled after a month.

I love it! and i've gotten compliments on it already. It's the perfect size if you want to use it instead of your purse, if you don't have one of those huge purses. For me it fits- a regular sized library book, a pocket dictionary, a daily planner, feminine products, a pack of pens, a mini language grammar book, my wallet, keys (it also comes with a strip and a hook to attach to your key rings) and i still haven't used the pocket in the very back or the pouch in the front. It holds a better number of things than i thought. I really do like it- i just wish it was one inch taller to hold my textbook but I don't use it every day so this is a great every day bag instead of a purse. the zipper isn't uncomfortable at all either.
summary: I love it! and i've gotten compliments on it already

reviewText: Cute dress good for price but bust is a bit small to size.

I am 5'10" and an evenly proportioned 210 lbs, with a 40DD chest. I really like the color and stretch to this dress, but I had issues with three main things. First, the chest of the dress starts too high and thus ends too high on the torso. Secondly, the flair of the dress at the hips was a bit more than I expected. I will say that I'd rather have more flair than not enough, but it kind of felt like the dress was clinging for dear life on the top and running away from the bottom half. Finally, what makes this dress unwearable for me is how tight the back of the arms are. It is a cap sleeve so I was thinking that I shouldn't have an issue with it, but the give in the sleeve is not the best. I'm going to return it.
summary: I really like the color and stretch to this dress

reviewText: It is a nice dress, but it wrinkles so easily. I wish it was made with a different material.

I'm bummed about the quality of this dress. To begin with, the color is much brighter than the emerald in the picture; it's more like plastic tree green.  The seams are already coming apart in several spots. The material feels cheap, although it is not see through. It fits okay because of the spandex, but the arms are too tight. If I had ordered a size larger, the chest would gape. And the zipper is almost impossible to get up by myself. For $20, I guess this dress isn't bad, but probably not going to wear it to any garden parties...
This looks on me like it has been designed for me - love it! I wear an M. It took several weeks to get to me, but definitely worth waiting.
Dress is comfortable and good to wear for any occassion.

I love the fit and style, but was disappointed in the color. I ordered the dress you see in the first picture which is a dark fall green, but as you can see in the other picture, I received a much brighter summer green. The company has updated their picture since I ordered the dress, but if the former dress was out of stock, I would have preferred they let me know rather than send me a similar substitute. Other than that, I have no complaints. I have received many compliments and the brighter color is starting to grow on me.
summary: I love the fit and style

reviewText: This is an adorable dress, just be prepared to unwrap an item that needs to be IRONED. I personally found it to be a bit high-necked in the front, but that would work well for larger-busted women who struggle to keep the girls contained. As for me... I have a long torso and smaller chest, and I feel like I might need to alter the front to be a bit lower -- not even for the sake of showing cleavage, just because it's a strange amount of fabric coming all the way up in front. The construction seems pretty solid for the price, just be prepared for a few tiny threads to trim, nothing major. It is fun to twirl in!!! The cap sleeves are very subtle and not too flared -- perfect for a girl like me who already has wide shoulders and doesn't want to accentuate them anymore. Despite thinking I might alter it, I'd have no problem wearing it "as is."
Wish the skirt was a little longer so that it could twirl better. Otherwise,  very happy with the dress.

reviewText: These outfits are absolutely adorable and a very good quality for the price, considering they are US Polo $18.99 + free Prime shipping. Now they do run small. My grandson is 10 months and appr 20 pounds, I first ordered the 12 months one for him it fit perfect, except the bottoms are a tad snug. Not what appears to be uncomfortably so, but I suspect that once its been washed and dried the bottoms will be too small. So (because I liked it so well) I went ahead and ordered a second set in a 18 months for him thinking I could use the bigger bottoms with the smaller tops. Upon arrival and just looking at the bottoms I cant tell any size difference in the 12 & 18 month bottoms. But still its a great 3 piece outfit perfect for fall earky winter. I especially like the hood on the vest for warmer but windy days.

I love my new bag! I'm absolutely impressed with the quality of this bag. I were it daily to work as a purse, especially when I go shopping and I don't want to carry big purse on my shoulder, also when I'm waking with my kids and want free hands....its just perfect.
This bag is the perfect size to carry the essentials without getting too heavy and tired. It easily fits a wallet, cell phone, snacks and makeup bag. It is really nicely made with strong stitching and more room than I expected. The back of it has a small zipper pocket. There is a thick handle at the top for carrying or hanging it up. The straps can almost double in length. On the front is a zippered pocket that protrudes out and a small zippered pocket on the front of that. The flap covering the top has a flap on it that covers a tiny zippered pocket. To open up the back pack you have to unclip the large flap from from a ring by squeezing the clip together. The bag closes with a drawstring type of process using a PU Leather rope. The interior has a small zippered pocket and a large open pocket that is split into two sections. One is flat and the other slightly puffs out to hold larger items.
Again I love this bag and will definitely recommend it.

reviewText: Tbh I loved it at first sight it had no rips or tairs,the material is great and I love the look of the backpack. I'm personally gonna use this Bag for school purposes and I hope this bag will last me the entire year, I will post again after the year to tell you how the bag lasted.

A very nice, well-made product.  Lots of room/pockets for everything needed, including a laptop/tablet pocket.  The adjustable shoulder straps were padded and quite comfortable.  The front pocket is magnetically closed, the strap is for decoration.  Seems to be water resistant, but was unable to find out, no rain.

The company sent me this backpack in exchange or a review.

It seems really well-made. I don't know how it will stand up over an entire school year, but there is plenty of room for supplies. It's cute but not babyish, so a middle or high schooler won't feel self-conscious carrying it.  It's not even a bad-looking casual bag for an adult commuter.

The straps are padded and comfortable. There are enough pockets to keep things organized.

This company has sent me backpacks before, and they're all decent. If you like the color/pattern, this is a good choice.

For the record, I received this as a gift for testing and review purposes. The company asked for no special favors in return.

As others have mentioned, this is a nice, little backpack, with a "cute" color scheme. I know it's cute because wife says it is. Coincidentally, she had been looking for a little backpack to use when we go hiking or on long walks. She had been looking for an alternative to her purse, which she carries everywhere, and which was something I had been giving her a hard time about. Why? Because she's always telling me to watch it while she goes to the bathroom, or "Don't forget to lock the doors of the truck, because her purse is in there." And I'm like: "Why did you bring your purse? We're eighty miles from the nearest store." Or she'll ask me to keep an eye on her purse when it's sitting on our restaurant table six inches away from my right hand. How can I not keep an eye on the purse when it's right in front of my face? But I digress...

She likes this backpack. The pack is light, but made from quality materials, and it has padded straps. There is plenty of room for books, papers, a laptop, and it has a nice zippered pouch on the inside and two side pockets for water bottles. It's perfect for my wife because she can dump the essential contents of her purse into the zippered pouch and carry a sweater and/or windbreaker and water. I wouldn't put keys or anything metallic and sharp into the zippered pouch area. Phone, wallet, money, makeup, divorce lawyers contact information, stuff like that.

Because the backpack doesn't have a belt attached to it, I would not recommend it for someone who is doing serious mountain climbing. For the same reason, if you work as a bicycle or motorcycle delivery person on busy metropolitan streets, you'll probably want a pack you can secure to your torso at multiple points. All of its cuteness won't do you much good if the pack slides sideways while you're trying to avoid a bus or a rock slide.

Anyway, my wife likes it, and that's all that matters.

This black & white design is very cute! There is lots of room inside the main compartment and on one side is a padded pouch (11" x 11") with an elastic Velcro closure that could hold a laptop. I tried my 14" laptop and it fit, although I had to really stretch the strap to get the Velcro to stick. On the other side are a couple small 3 1/2" wide pouches that might fit your cell phone (mine wouldn't fit without taking off the case) and also a zipper pocket.

It has two 7 1/2" deep by 6" wide side pockets which are wide enough and deep enough to hold my water bottle; I don't normally find that in a backpack. I have a few backpacks and this is the only one that will fit my water bottle in the side pocket. I usually have to put my water bottle inside the pack so I really like that feature.  It also has a large 7 1/2" deep and 11" wide front pocket and even though it shows a buckle it actually closes with a magnetic snap.

The pack has a loop in the back to hang it up. The shoulder straps are slightly padded and adjustable. There are two zippers that close the main compartment. The stitching is well done and I don't find any rips or tears.

This is a smaller pack than some I have, but it can hold a lot. Right now it's holding my current crochet project and all my accessories. I will be taking this to my knitting/crochet group, especially since it's so convenient now carrying my water bottle (which goes with me everywhere).

I was provided this backpack for testing and review.

The wife wanted a new diaper bag and found this. While this bag easily functions as a work/laptop bag, it also quite amazingly works as a diaper bag. The pockets are plentiful and fit all manner of diapers, onesies and bottles. The material is also tough, making for a bag that won't tear after a few days. This bag is a winner folks!
summary: Great multi-use bag for a great price

The Winkine Casual Style Lightweight Striped School Bag Backpack is very well made and can be used for school or as a travel carryon bag. The backpack straps are well padded making it easy to carry around. There is a small compartment on the back that closes with a magnetic snap. It is suitable for holding items that you want to get to quickly. This compartment is padded so it would be safe for most items. Inside the main compartment is a separate section for a small to medium laptop. It is well padded and there is a Velcro strap to keep the laptop securely in place. There is also a zippered compartment and two pockets for storage. The backpack is made with heavy duty canvas. The black and white stripes are very attractive and there is a nice leather logo at the top of the bag. This is not a particularly large bag I would call it medium. But it is very well made and very attractive. It will certainly hold a laptop and quite a bit of other personal items. The zippers are very sturdy and have leather pull tabs on the zipper pull tabs. This is a very attractive, well made backpack. I think you will get lots of wear from this bag. I was provided a sample for testing/review purposes.

This is such a great looking bag.  I love the crisp clean lines and leather detailing.  Anyone would love to receive this as a gift.

The bag is the perfect size.  Not so big that you can over stuff it and cause back pain.  Yet large enough to store all the things you need for daily use or for a weekend get away.  The bag is true to the description as far as size. It measures 17.7 H ,13.5 L , 6.7 W.  I especially like the care the designer too in construction and organization.  On the out side of the bag there are two pockets perfect to stash a water bottle and compact umbrella. On the outside front, there is a quick access pouch with a snap closure, ideal for item you use often like keys, wallet or travel documents.
Inside the bag is a large roomy space for book, clothes or other essentials.  There is a lightly padded storage space for your electronic devices that latches with a velcro strap.  In addition, there are two phone pockets and a zippered storage pouch sewn onto the lining.  The back and the straps are lightly padded for a comfortable wearing experience.  The straps can be adjusted longer if necessary.

I really like this bag and plan on using it for years to come.  I highly recommend this product.

 A sample was provided to me for consumer testing.  This review is my report of my personal, unbiased experience using this item.
summary: This is such a great looking bag

reviewText:
This is perfect for the casual day out.  Nice padded shoulder straps and plenty of storage for all your needs.  Even includes a laptop pouch so you don't have to take a second bag!  Looks much better than most bags on the market as well.  In my opinion, at least?!  Doesn't have that stiff feeling you usually get when purchasing a new backpack.  This is really the perfect bag for the kids to take to school.  Nice and soft as well.

I received this product in exchange for an unbiased/honest review.
summary: Nice quality bag with a LOT of space inside!

reviewText:
I got this for my great niece who is a budding fashionista. This back pack passed her fashion flare test with flying colors On the practical side it holds her note books, pencil case, ipad and school books easily. Unfortunately I forgot to take measurements before I gave it to her.

It appears to be sturdy, but only time will tell for sure, but at this point it is serving its purpose very well.

This backpack sample was provided for testing and review with no guarantee of a favorable review.

I was offered this backpack for free in order to evaluate it and write an honest review. If you have read my reviews, you will find I am sometimes brutally honest about flaws. When I give five stars, it was deserved.

Update: 9/30/15 pack is crammed with a 15.3 laptop, charger and a few other things like my ipad. Total weight inside is about 10 pounds. The straps adjusted to help keep the weight centered on my back. A friend saw me with it when she drove me to the train, said liked the look and needed a good sturdy back pack. She hinted strongly that she wanted it. Laptop is a snug fit, but very easily done. Padded pocket helps protect my pack.

This pack is cute, it is a nautical type of theme. The pack is made from thick canvas like material that is heavy. I tested a backpack several months ago that looked the same, but in terms of quality, this one wins. This one is much thicker material. The other one was equally cute, but this one is the sturdier of the two. Like buying jeans and jean leggings that look exactly the same, this one is the winner of the two packs.

The pockets are great. I can fit everything from a camera to a sports bottle in them. The inside will hold books or clothes. Take it to the beach, use it as a trendy carry on bag. Front pocket holds an iPad mini in an otterbox case for size of the pocket idea. The front is a magnetic snap closure, not a buckle. That could be important to some of you.

The bag is well sewn, I don't think it is washable except by hand washing and it might bleed blue onto white. I will stick to spot washing.
summary: Very strong fabric, made to last.

I bought a tutu to go under and it was great and made the costume. The goggles, necklace and boot covers weren't great however. The goggles did not stay on my head and the necklace was way to big. I did end up using necklace in my hair so that was good. The boot covers probably would have worked had I worn boots with heels. I wanted to wear flat soled boots and the elastic that keeps them on didn't have anywhere to go to keep them on right. I went and bought some steampunk spats and wore with dark tights and it was way better. Overall it was a great costume. My husband definitely liked it!!

I did size up. Normally I'm an XL and I ordered the XXL and it fits great! It also felt too short with the petticoat underneith.  The length of the skirt is pretty accurate to the picture, I'm 5-4ish and it was maybe just a hair longer without the bussle. The fabric feels nice and it looks great on! It's just a little small in the chest (I wear a size 38DD), but that's always a problem area for me.  I'm not using the gloves.  I found them to be a little wonky and clumsy, but that's really a nitpick.  This is perfect for the Halloween events I have coming up.  The goggles are hard and rigid, so I bent them slighly and they sit better on my head that way.  Super cute costume, I highly recommend!

reviewText: This bag is adorable! And way cheaper than anything you will buy at the parks or Disney Stores. I love it! I throw all my makeup into it with plenty of room to spare. Thank you!

This tote arrived carefully folded in half and sealed in a plastic bag. I was pleasantly surprised by how thick and sturdy the material is. It is made out of a slick, yet textured, nylon material. The print of Alice is actually in the material. It's not a cheap plastic overlay that will peel off.
The stitching is high quality as well; I don't suspect this will fall apart even with heavy use. The tote has a gusseted bottom, making it easy to stuff full with out it bulging uncomfortably.

With no size specifications in the description, I suspected the tote might be quite small. Unfortunately, I was right. Laying flat, the tote measures 14" x 9". Being that size, it's definitely not a tote I'd take grocery shopping.

The main reason for my 3 star rating is that the bag has "NOT FOR SALE" written on it in big, bold, white letters. (see photo) What upsets me more, is that the seller went out of their way to carefully mark that out on their photo of the tote. I didn't notice it when I first purchased it, but it became quite apparent once I was looking for it. Seems quite deceptive.

Overall, I like the bag. It's high quality and inexpensive. As long as the "NOT FOR SALE" note doesn't bother you, I consider it a good buy for any Alice in Wonderland fan.
summary: Quality tote with one glaring drawback

UPDATE:

I put a little brake cleaner on the ring and worked it around twice. This caused the ring two swell just enough that it's a much better fit. If you'r rings too tight and you can't or don't want to return it, try the brake cleaner, it worked for me. NOTE: Exposing it to harsh chemicals such as brake cleaner may reduce the integrity of the ring causing damage.

So I wore these tights to my friend's wedding.  I had a different pair of plain nude pantyhose that I had been planning to wear, but ended up choosing these at the last minute because I tore the nude ones.  I had traveled for the wedding and didn't have any other backup pairs.  As it turns out I'm really glad I tore the plain ones because the wedding was a black tie event in downtown Seattle and I really feel that these took my outfit to the next level!  I was wearing an almost floor length dark blue dress with a slit up the side, I LOVED how it looked with the lace pattern peeking out. My husband loved it too ;)

pros:

1) The material these pantyhose are knit out of is very soft, not scratchy at all.
2) The fact that they fit me!  I was a little uncertain if they would work because I'm a US size 12-14 and these are a "one size", but they were great! Plenty of stretch.
3) material seemed to hold up well, nothing snagged or ripped.  Granted I wasn't doing anything crazy, but still.  As you read above I have a history of ripping my pantyhose!!

cons:

1) Not control top.  This wasn't a problem for me because I had a slimming garment I wore on top of the nylons but if I hadn't been wearing that, you probably could have seen a faint outline of the waistband because my dress was tight fitting.
2) seemed to be a little more "toe room" than I needed, didn't really matter because of my shoes though.

Overall I really liked these tights, especially the flirty print.  Will be adding more of this brand to my stash!

reviewText:
The bathing suit is cute but the sizing is awful. I weigh around 150, I'm 5'4ish and my weight distribution is average for my size. I wear a 34-36c bra and ~ size 6-8 pants. I got this in a XL (US 8-10).

The top is WAAAAAY to big. Like, I thought I was relatively large in the chest area, but this is insane. I'd classify this as something like a 38DD. It makes me feel like a 12 year old boy. I can't imagine anyone of average size who wears a US 8-10 fitting into this. There is no way I could wear this in public. Even tied as tight as it goes, it hangs somewhere in my mid-region and rests about 3 inches away from my skin.

The worst part is, the bottom is a bit too small. You'd expect it to be as large as the top, right? Nope. It's made for someone who's disadvantaged in the behind, I suppose. The leg holes are uncomfortably tight around my thighs and my waist is bordering on a muffin top when I put this on. The polka dots on my butt become little pink ovals and the blue becomes slightly see-through.

Maybe I'd have better things to say if the top and bottom were actually a coordinating size - I'd just decide that I bought too large, or too small. But this swimsuit is definitely designed for Barbie or someone similarly top-heavy. I'm very confused and somewhat afraid. However, it's adorable, and the material seems nice, so I'll give it that.
I got it 2 sizes up and it's still snug. Very cute but small.

It's a cute swimsuit for the price. The bottoms fit great, but I wish the top fit better, provided better coverage. It might be a lounge around the pool suit more than something I'd really want to spend much time swimming in.

What a shame this was. I was so excited, and bought this before a lake trip. I followed suggestions from reviews to order a size up if in between sizes, so I ordered a medium. I'm around 131 pounds, 62 inches, and everything is in my thighs/butt/hip area. The medium was still way too big for my lower half; I think a small might have sufficed and fit nicely.
 The top, however, was unrealistic, but maybe that's just because I have no boobeez. The circumference of the top sucked the life out of the width of my top half, but then there was the vacant empty cups where I think boobs are supposed to go.
 I don't think ordering a size down would have solved the problem, because the band fit too tightly around me as a medium. A size down would suffocate me, and then I'd still have the issue where the bust is too empty and easily reveal my dad nips. (Auto correct changed "sad" to "dad" but it was too funny to fix.)
I'm really sad about this purchase, but I returned it and got my money back... minus a dollar I had to pay for at UPS for the return print out sticker. Please beware. I should have known looking at the pictures on the reviews of more upper-half-blessed women in the photos. I really want to give more than 1 star because it was really cute, but I'm hurt.

reviewText:
As I was looking for a more nautical-looking swimsuit, I realized I've had this baby for two years and never posted a review. Here's what what this thing looks like after two summers of good use.
I'm 5ft 3in and 200lbs. Whenever I wear this out in public, people always ask me where I got it. I love the vintage look and the fact that it's lasted as long as it has. Plus, it's easy to take care of. Simply wash it on the delicate setting and let it hang to dry. I even bled through it a little and it didn't remain stained.
If you're looking for a retro-ish swimsuit that's cute and will last a long time, this is the swimsuit to get.

reviewText: It was perfectly described, but didn't suit my body type

The bathing suit arrived early and in a plastic carry slide zip bag, which is a nice detail. The colors are bright and did not bleed after washing (delicate, cold, line dry) or while in the pool. Unfortunately I didn't LOVE the way it fit. Top I think was a tad small bc it didn't lie flat between my breast. The cups fit ok. Theyre lined with thin padding so you won't show nipping and it gives some support but definitely didn't give me a lift or push up. I did like the halter around neck because straps were thicker and placed nicely to cover the little fat armpit bulge. The band is thick around the waist and nicely hides a small fat roll. So none of that back bra fat bulge. The drawback to the top was that you have to pull it over your head and slide it down, like a sports bra sorta, and that was NOT fun trying to take off while wet and needed a little assistance taking it off. My teen daughter got a good laugh from it. The bottoms were slightly too large and didn't have snug support. I have what I like to call a kangaroo pouch fupa flap (aka slightly droopy belly above csection scar) so bottoms didn't give the supported fit Id hoped for. Once out of the water, the material didn't rouge at sides anymore it draped so loosely and seriously accentuated the flappy pooch. Id agree that it would be nice to pick separate sizes for tops and bottoms. However, for the price of this suit the material was better than I expected. I was corncerned it would be thin and easily see through, bleed colors everywhere and disintegrate once exposed to water. It didnt. I am short and so the bottoms were higher than probably most but it didn't bother me bc it showed the only sliver of tummy that doesnt have stretch marks or cellulite. Just was not a good fit for me since bottoms became so loose after being in water. Im 50, 170 lbs and wear a 38-40 D depending on brand and 12-14 bottoms. Not the worst bathing suit but I did purchase two other sets from Amazon and those gave a much more flattering look.

reviewText: I was so excited when the package arrived and this bathing suit fit perfect!! Wanted to give it a 5 star review. Was wondering why something was off and realized the straps were attached all wrong on the top!! One strap is attached towards the outer edge of the bra cup and the other one towards the inside!! So so disappointed!! It looks like they are in a hurry to finish all their orders and are not checking the garment.. the bottom fits and looks great though...
summary: Top sewn incorrectly. Not wearable! What a disappointment!!

reviewText:
Im 57 and 190lbs. My chest is 38DD and my hips are 43 so I got the 4XL. It fit pretty good. My chest wasn't oozing out, and I had support from the back. The cups didn't fit all the way but covered enough. You can feel the bottom of bra not touch your torso but I had support enough to enjoy a relaxing day at the beach. The bottoms fit just right, not too tight and not too lose.
I did buy the red and black with polka dot as well but the chest didn't fit so well. The straps in the back didn't really support my 38DD chest. The bottoms fit good though.
summary: It fit pretty good. My chest wasn't oozing out

reviewText: Its a really pretty swimsuit, but found that the fit is my only reason why its 3 stars. Im usually a large in everything and find that Im in the 8ish 10 category in pants and swimsuits and a medium to large on top.. but large is too tight on the bottom and definitely too tight on top! Im usually good at guesstimating my size but truly large to me is more like a medium.. and the top was definitely for a small chest! Definitely recommend going a size up in this suit!!
summary: 1 size up!! Good quality, good price just size up!

reviewText: Love this swimsuit! Definitely measure yourself before buying.

The material was nicer than I expected.  Depending on your body shape you may run into trouble (as is the case with any two piece sold together in the same size).  The bottom fit fine (with some extra room), but the top was too small for my 34DD.  I had to return it and chose not to buy again in a different size, as the next size up would likely be to large on the bottom.  I ordered the L.  I am 5'3" 135 lbs (M top, 8-10 bottom, 6 in dresses).
summary: The bottom fit fine (with some extra room)

reviewText: I read most of the comments on this bathing suit and most people sized up. I am 50 and weigh about 148lbs. I usually wear mediums but bought a size large in with this bathing suit.  I went one size up because Im usually a size up bust wise. The bottoms are a little loose in the tummy area but not too bad. Definitely worth the price and its so cute for women with curves right?
summary: When one size up from what I usually wear!

reviewText: Top is tiny. Like comically tiny. Bottoms fit fine.

But didn't fit me. I ordered the larger size and got a large... I should have stuck with my own size. The company was very accommodating and I plan to order another one (in a smaller size) next time it's on the Today's Deals - or maybe I'll wait until Amazon Prime Day!
Love this suit! Im about a size 16 and ordered the 4x. I could have probably went with the 3x especially since Im only a B cup. But still fits great and I feel comfortable in it!
My wife LOVED IT

I like the color ( I got the turquoise with the black & white aztec bottoms) and I loved that aspect, however the patterned bottom gives the appearance of a larger midsection. I also am normally a 10/12 with a 36D bust. The 10/12 2xl size was too small for my breasts & they bunched out of the top.
summary: Patterned bottom makes you look fatter

reviewText: I love this swimsuit. It fit perfectly and very comfortable.

Being a bigger busted gal I love that the top has underwire in it, so the girls are lifted up just a enough. Very well made. The bottoms hide my mom pouch, without making me feel like an old lady. I'll be buying more in different colors before the end of summer!
Love this bathing suit! Its comfortable and arrived very fast!

I love this bathing suit!!!!! I don't usually write reviews but how could I not for this suit. I ordered the purple print one. It's so unique and vintage. It fits my body so well, giving me good coverage but still looking flirty. It's also comfortable. And for under 30 how can you beat the price?! Love it, I'm happy.
Love the bottoms but the top is a stiff bra that makes you look bigger than you are. Wish you could buy this in separates.
summary: Love the bottoms but the top is a stiff bra ...

reviewText: I love this style

After reading all the reviews and sizing chart, I opted for the 2XL. What drew me to this specific swimsuit is that the top wasn't a halter top and just a regular bikini/bra top. Halter bikini tops make my neck hurt after a while and I don't feel as secure in them. The top fit perfectly at this size (I'm a 36D) and the bottom was good too, although maybe one size smaller would have been a little better. I love these 2- piece high- waisted swimsuits as they give me the option to show off in 2 pieces but not be completely exposed in parts where I'm not as confidence. I'll probably order a different color in the future!
summary: Great Swimsuit & Feel Great Wearing it in Public

reviewText: Over all I really liked this suit. It is a little snug in the leg area and the cups are too small but I have thicker thighs and Gcup breasts so both are to be expected.

reviewText: I confirmed with the size chart provided, ordered a 3XL, bottoms fit great, top is way to small.  The top was def not a 3XL.  Thankful I am able to return for a refund and will try again.

reviewText: Love it!

This bathing suit was cute in the picture but was not cut how I expected. The support in the bust was way to small. I wanted to return it so bad. I am a curvy lady and order the 3xl. I thought the bottoms would have more a control at the top. My mom pouched looked larger than what I expected.
summary: A little off for curvy ladies

reviewText: I absolutely love this product ! The fit was perfect based on their fit guide and I love the way it contours my body !!! Great buy and product so happy

reviewText: I really wanted to love this bikini. It was so cute. However the top was just a little too small. I ordered a Large and I am a C cup (DD at Victoria's Secret) and the underwire hit just a little too high making it pretty uncomfortable. Could I have made it work? Probably, but I chose comfort over style. And an extra warning: the color is slightly off- it's much more of a neon coral/orange, which I personally liked better than what the picture shows.

reviewText: This bathing suit was nice but the top was too small. I ordered a 3xl= 12/14 The bottom fit great. I regret returning it since I could have used it with a different top.

reviewText: Color and style

One thing i don't really like is that the bra cups are like Viking helmets - they are very stiff and hold my girls in an unnatural shape.  They are also very narrow.  Other than that, i love the design and high waist hit me perfect.
Nice!

Great bathing suit & very flattering! Fits exactly as expected. I do wish you could order different sizes in tops and bottoms. I got a medium and I probably could've used a size large top. I am 5'2", 135#. I DEFINITELY recommend this swimsuit! I absolutely love it! I guess I should have known better judging by the price of this suit, but I was paying more attention to the reviews which were high. I ordered the set with navy polka dot bottoms and got pink top. Definitely wouldnt recommend... I would return this set, but for paying less than $10 for it and then having to pay for return shipping it wouldnt be worth it.

reviewText: I'm 5'5" 200 lbs 36C solid size 12. I ordered the 4X because I have a pretty large butt. The bottoms fit good, but this top is all kinds of messed up. I think if you were allowed to mix and match the top and bottom sizes, so many women would not run into this issue. The straps are adjustable but really flimsy(I imagine one good wave hitting me in the ocean and these straps will be gone forever), the cups are stiff and so I'm having to constantly adjust my boobs. While it looks outwardly cute, I don't see how I could swim in this. If you are planning on just lounging by the pool and taking a quick dip just to cool off....this is the suit for you. Not sure if I'm going to just return or exchange for a smaller size. The latter seems like too much of a gamble.
summary: Looks OK but not exactly functional

reviewText:
Ok, y'all. I've always been a big girl, which generally meant one piece bathing suits with skirts or shorts and so many cover ups. I've recently lost some weight and decided I'd give a 2 piece a try.

This bathing suit is phenomenal. It is the first 2 piece I've worn in public since middle school and I'm nearly 30. The ruching on the belly helps disguise that last bit of of problem area and the waist is high so it hides the crazy stretch marks from my pregnancy. It stays in place up top even when playing with my toddler and makes me feel so glamorous. Definitely recommended.
The top is too small and the bottom is too big

The  bathing suit is really cute. I returned it because it didn't fit my current body. I am slim but just had a baby the size chart suggest I am a small I bought a medium to be safe anyway the top was wayyyy too small (but that might be because I am breastfeeding) the bottom was fine, be worn it gives you a camel toe. I didn't give it 5 stars because it didn't fit
The top is a little big, but the bottoms are perfect. Nice quality.
summary: Can't beat it for the price!

reviewText: I love this swim suit...i have always been self-conscious about my belly after having a  child....and this suit covers very nicely. ..I am a size 4-5 jeans medium tops (36 c bra size) i weigh about 135-140 lbs and i am 5'4 tall and i ordered a size medium and it fits great!!!! i highly recommend this swim suit ..Its adorable and the most comfortable swimsuit i have ever had...Im not scared to have children climbing and laying all over me and having a wardroom malfunction lol Great Product!

50 138lbs and ordered a large. I am larger in the butt and hips. Very cute bikini. Many compliments in this. Waist is cute and not saggy. I found the bottoms to be a little tight on the seam over the butt cheeks. Overall a great product!

I wear a 34C or 32D, depending on the bra. I got a large to accommodate my large bottom. Too big the on the ribcage area, no lift at all. The bottom fit awesome but the top was a disaster. Made from good material and the quality is worth the $20-$30 price but if it doesnt fit, what does it matter?

I'd say it's safe to follow this below and you'll be good :-)

S=  0
M= 2
L=  4
XL= 6
2X= 8
3X= 10
4X= 12
5X= 14/16

reviewText:
I'm having a hard time reviewing this swimsuit because the basic problem is that the top & bottom are such dramatically different sizes! I read other reviews saying that before, but since I have a huge booty and a small chest, I thought this swimsuit combination would be perfect for me. Since other people left their measurement info & I found it helpful, I'll do the same -- my bra size is 30E. I'm 130 lbs, 5'2", and very pear-shaped.

I think, for me, the real problem wasn't that the top is small, it's that the *cups* on the top are really small. The band, for me, was plenty large. I think they're probably using a conventional size like a 36B or something as the basis for the top. Since that isn't my size (and since my chest has an annoyingly unusual size), it made the bra part fit really awkwardly. Basically, the sides of the top were baggy and slouching and kept moving up & down, but then my boobs were smooshing out to the sides and top of the cups. Loose where it should be tight, but way too tight and constrained where there should have been more room.

The bottoms fit great, so no complaints there. It's also a really pretty pattern, so I'm bummed. I'll be returning this.
summary: Cup size is tiny, band is normal, bottoms are perfect

Wow! I bought this costume last year and realized it was completely inappropriate and problematic.

The Day of the Dead is a historically significant holiday in Mexico. Wearing this costume exploited elements of that culture without actually acknowledging its history and its rich meaning. This costume reduces a complex tradition into a flimsy outfit for one-time use.

I'm giving this costume one-star because Halloween is all about having fun and enjoying ourselves-but it doesn't have to be at the expense of cultures, histories and entire traditions. If you want to celebrate the Day of the Dead I recommend learning more about it and it's meaning, instead of wearing it as a costume because you think it looks cool.

reviewText:
I love this!  Yes, it is on a smaller scale than the brooch used in the show but it is still well made and feels sturdy.  It is a great conversation starter, especially if you run into another Game of Thrones fan.  It is solid, the coloring is a burnished gold and it has a good amount of detail.  Even up close I was not disappointed with the attention that was paid to it.  It is reasonably priced and it doesn't look or feel like it is going to fall apart at a moment's notice.

This is a good replica that is easy to identify from the show.  I have enjoyed wearing it and the reactions that I have received from it.  If you're a big enough fan you'll find a reason to wear something like this proudly, no matter what you are wearing or where you are going.  I received this product free or at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review.  Thank you for reading.
summary: Winter's not coming for a while, but this brooch is here!

reviewText:
I was not sure if I would like this brooch but I love it! Its larger than I expected, and I expected something maybe a half inch. I'm so glad I took a change and bought this. The package came quickly and with no broken parts. The dagger was slightly bent up but I was able to bend it straight. It may have been the design of the maker for the dagger to not be straight.

The dagger portion is not very sharp so I do not have to worry about hurting myself or others by mistake. The finish is true to the photo provided by the seller. The details of this piece are astonishing for something this size. On the back of the piece there is a swivel locking pin that appears to have been soldered on which makes me feel that this piece will not easily get lost. I received this product at a discounted rate for the purpose of testing and giving my honest unbiased review.

I placed this piece on my messenger bag and have been receiving nothing but compliments!
summary: I was not sure if I would like this brooch but I love it

reviewText: Way too small, looks cheap... it feels likes its about to break just by looking at it...

I received this item at a discount or complimentary in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

reviewText:
The supplier kindly sent this item to me in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. Their kind offer does not affect my personal opinion about the item.

When travel, I always find it a bit of a pain to manage my underwear.  If I put my bras and the panties in the same bag (drawstring/carry bags), then they will mix up or some bras would hook onto the others.  If I put them in separate bags, there will be too many bags to unpack/pack.  Now this simple, yet brilliant idea  an underwear travel case, does help me solve the problem.

The case has one main compartment for your bras, I say it can fit about 3- 5 bras(depends on your bras are heavily padded or not , and also your size of the bras).  There are also 3 mesh pockets for panties or socks.  Yes only 3 mesh pockets, but again panties are easy, you can always put more in the case sit them next to the bras.  I don't think they will get messy when everything is snuggly fitted in.

Sizing is as described, the case looks as good as it shows online, except for the colour.  I got the pink one, but in reality it is closer to red.  It is hard to photograph the real colour as my photos here make the case looks like purple.  Therefore, I tinted one of my photos here (pic A) to show the real colour better. (I didn't tint all the photos as it is too much work).

The case is of great quality in my opinion.(enclosed couple closer shots for quality referene)  The zips are sturdy, no trouble in turning the corners.  The stitches are good.  Inside is fully lined with the same material used on the outside.  The top and the bottom of the case is hard-ish, could be cardboard inside to keep the shape.  Inside there is the manufacturers /suppliers label, which is always a good sign of a good quality item.  I am also liking the handle on the top which comes in handy when taking to the bathroom.

I am very happy with this little bag, I would recommend for others, just have to take a notion of the colour.  Hope this helps.
Exactly as described on Amazon.  Great material quality.

I am 5'5" and it hits me 5 inches above me ankles.  The skirt is very full without being bulky.  I ordered this while recovering from hip surgery as I had to wear a full thigh to ankle leg brace for six weeks and remain in a wheel chair, so the bulkiness and comfort were important to me.  I don't have to wear the leg brace anymore, but this is still my favorite skirt!  My only complaint is that the under skirt which is made of white lingerie type material is too short and rides up around my waist, thus the four stars.  If it were a little longer and made of slightly heavier cloth it would be perfect!

reviewText: This pin has changed my life ever since I bought it. Everyday on my car ride to work and school I wanted to die inside. Now that I have this pin I have a boost of confidence that I have never had before. All the cute memer chicks come up to me now and ask for my number and ask where I got this pin. Every time i look in to Pepe's eye I see the dark depression that lives inside all of us and that we will all die someday. When ever I look at Pepe's face I see my own face whenever I go into the depressing place I call work and school on those dark and dreary days. At the end of the day I realize that the world is a very dark and depressing place that will slowly kill us and we will all be forgotten in the sands of time. Pepe will always be around for he is the dankest meme around and will live on in our hearts and in our childerns hearts. Whenever someone asks me about why I became a memer I tell them it is because of the never ending depression that haunts my soul and to someday have the sweet release of death.

reviewText:
I am 5'4, 130 pounds, and everything I own is size medium or small.  I ended up returning the medium and getting a large because the medium was a little too tight for my modest taste.  It wasn't way too small, I just didn't want clingy.  The material is thin and doesn't leave much to the imagination, but very light and comfortable.  The large hung on me perfectly and I love the dress.  Beware though, horizontal stripes really show your curves.
EDIT...  There were no washing instructions on the dress, so I washed in cold water and dried on low just like I do my other rayon blend dresses.  The black faded so badly it's not wearable.  I'm so disappointed because I really love this dress.

The fabric is just a teensy bit thin, but it is very soft and true to size.  It isn't clingy nor is it too loose on your hips, so works great for hourglass figures since the fabric is rather form fitting but stretchy, so I suspect it will look good on those with a thinner frame/hips as well.  I intend to wear this as just an every day and lazy weekends dress, not for any occasion since it is a little bit thin in terms of fabric but all the more reason it is a great summer dress, especially as a beach coverup.  It is super comfortable, even when you have a little more of a tummy than you'd like.  I weigh 170 lbs (not my finest season this year!) with a 36 to 38 DDD bust so I've needed to upsize some of my summer clothes (bummer), but ordered the XL and it fits perfectly.
summary: This dress is simplistic and oh so comfortable!

reviewText: Love this dress.  The material is thin, but very quality feeling.  no loose threads. deep black stripe.  slightly off-white stripe.  I had read that it ran a tad big so I ordered an L.  It's a tiny bit too small, but I should have known. I'm an XL - no way around it!  I'm 5'8" - the length is perfect.  I can't wait to wear this on the beach in Cancun!
Great dress - fits well and is very comfy. Seems to wash nicely and will be great for travel.

Nice dress! Material is very soft. I had hoped it would shrink after washing but that was a no go. I'm 5' and have to hem most everything and this wasn't an exception unfortunately. So if you're of average height this dress will probably work. It's also very stretchy.

What I love about this dress is while it is gorgeous and can be worn for just about any occasion, it is one of the most comfortable dresses I own!  I am short, coming in at about five feet tall, but with heels this dress just reached the floor.  It is so beautiful and flowing!  It just falls perfectly everywhere it should.  I also love that it doesn't hug too tight.  It is tapered in around the waist and then flows down the hips loosely and elegantly.  It is such a breathable dress as well.  It is summer and I was worried about wearing this dress out because I thought surely it would cause me to overheat, but I was very comfortable all day and throughout the evening as well.  It can be worn anytime, anywhere!  I received many compliments on this dress and loved that it gave me a lot of length.  The stitching is well done and secure.  The hems are all straight and clean!  This dress is very flattering.  I love it.  I received this product complimentary in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
summary: Divers and very comfortable!  Perfect dress for any occasion

reviewText: I received this dress much faster than I was expecting it. I had the opportunity to review this dress in exchange for my honest opinion and review. I plan on wearing a belt with this dress to make the outfit "pop". I an 5'9 and weigh 133lbs. I ordered the medium and it fits wonderfully all around. I'm used to wearing dresses that are a little shorter because of my height and this dress was a little short on me, but it makes no difference to me. The dress is very comfy and stretchy. The stich in throughout the dress was good and no issues. This dress would be best worn in colder months rather than summer unless you live where its comfortable all year long :). I live in Washington and it is in the 90s and the material can make you hotter. I haven't seen a lot of dress with the unique half sleeves and I love this especially with the scoop neck! I did receive this for my opinion and all that I have said is my honest opinion.

This dress has a very interesting spandex feel. Great stretch and is very generous I'd say. I purchased a medium in this and it was tight on my bust but was a little loose on the waist where the fabric gathers for the skirt. I'm also fairly tall (5'9"), and the maxi dress goes to my ankles and doesn't drag. I would like it a wee bit longer but it still has decent length compared to other maxi dresses It has great details and is super cute. I can't wait for fall to be here so I can wear it more! To me the fabric isn't breathable enough for a hot day (and I purchased black which would make it way hotter). I do love it and can't wait to rock it. I did receive this product at a discounted rate for my unbiased review but I never guarantee a positive review, only a review that the product deserves.

reviewText: It was terrible. The tubes are so bendy, they were impossible to even get in. And once they got in, they ripped up the inside of my piercing and wouldn't close because I literally couldn't put pressure in a way that didn't make the stupid tubes bend in the piercing. And believe me, when they I say I couldn't close them, it isn't because it was physically painful. It did hurt, much more than actually getting it pierced, but my pain tolerance is immense and I needed this for a job interview. My fiance and I tried absolutely everything we could to close the dam* things but couldn't, I ended up just bending the tube up my nostril so it'd stay long enough to get me through the interview. I went back to my piercer immediately for good glass ones, since I bought these 4 months after piercing and my piercers don't give out the glass unless you're fully healed and at 6 months minimum, but by that point the wound was fresh AGAIN and I ended up just buying a tiny brown flat nose ring to pass as a freckle while this heals up AGAIN. And I had changed the piercing before several times to various hoop sizes, this piercing was fully healed before this stupid rubber piece of garbage opened me up again. I'd demand a refund if these cost more than $10 and I'd give it 0/5 stars if I could. I really ought to flag these as dangerous somehow so if there's a way to do that, somebody should do it or tell me how.

Purple is my favorite color, and as I finally decided to start a charm bracelet, I wanted to find a purple bracelet to wear them on. NinaQueen to the rescue! This purple leather wrapped style bracelet is exactly what I was looking for. The leather feels of good quality and the bracelet overall feels very sturdy and well made. The purple is a little darker than actually pictured, but for me that wasn't a problem. The magnetic clasp can be a little tricky to work on your own, but once you get the hang of it, it's easy to take on and off. I love the silver and purple clasp; it just adds a nice touch to the bracelet itself. My only wish is that it was a little thicker. I was kind of hoping that the leather bracelet would prevent my beads from sliding around so I wouldn't have to use spacer beads, but it's just as thin as the metal bracelets, so the beads do tend to slide around. Again, this still doesn't detract from the overall quality of the bracelet itself, and I would definitely buy it again! I'm very please with the bracelet and my NinaQueen beads look great on it!

reviewText: Bags are nice and sturdy.

These bags are very convenient until something leaks inside. Then you'll have it all over the rest of your belongings. I found this out the hard way while traveling. They are large and hold a lot, but just be aware they are water resistant and not waterproof. I think I will stick to using Ziploc bags. Also, after just a week of use, the lining is peeling off the inside of the bags.
summary: These bags are very convenient until something leaks inside. ...

reviewText:
These seem to good quality, however after reading "mesh bags" "mesh bags" over and over again I made the mistake of thinking these were an open mesh. Instead, the mesh provides extra protection and reinforcement over top of a tightly-sealed clear plastic bag. So if you want something to protect items from getting wet in the first place these will probably work great. However if you want something made of open mesh you can use for damp or sweaty clothes you wore outdoors, in the rain, running, to the gym etc. in which will allow them to dry out, then these organizers will trap the moisture inside so you're more likely to get mildew or other things growing.

You will not learn these are tightly sealed from the bulleted list of features. My bad for clicking "buy" after I read "mesh bags" for the second or third time and not reading to the very final bitter end of the product description where it mentions (almost as an afterthought)  "...and since there's a waterproof lining, you don't have to worry about unwanted spills and messes."

So nothing wrong with the product itself, but the product description is lousy because it's potentially misleading.
summary: Not what I expected - "mesh bags" means mesh over tightly sealed clear plastic

reviewText: Wow! Thought I ordered the multi-set, and I will when back in stock, BUT received the 4 large. These are quality bags that I can see multiple uses for - especially for our Registered Pet Therapy Teams. We are looking at the stroller bags now. Several of our teams use strollers for smaller dogs and cats while visiting hospitals and care facilities. I can see that a great advantage for freeing our arms, but still bringing our essentials into the facility for us and the pets! Thank You DotDotTravel.

I ordered a medium and was swimming in it!  I sent it which was quick and easy.  Re-ordered in a small and it seemed to fit fine although the straps on the shoulders were still too big.  I ended up cutting them in the back to make it a halter style and it worked perfectly.  The only reason I gave this dress 4 stars was because of the sizing, the dress itself is beautiful, the color is bright and summer and the material is light and cool.  Would recommend but advise to order smaller than you normally would!
summary: Beautiful Dress but Runs Very Large!

reviewText: I got this dress in black to wear in a wedding. As I unzipped it to try it on, the zipper got caught in the dress and WOULD NOT budge. I tried to fix it but the material of the dress started unraveling, so I left it alone and sent it back. I didn't get to try it on. I had bought one before this one and it was fine when I got it, but it was too big. I feel the zipper is kind of cheap and could have been easily broken on the other one too. I ended up getting a totally different dress, but the two other bridesmaids wore this one and they looked great. But one of the bridesmaids had to tuck in the straps because they were uneven, one was too long, which could be easily tacked and fixed. I sent both dresses back and got a full refund within a couple days which was very nice. I still think this is a good seller and the dress worked for the other girls. If you like it, I would definitely try it out! And if you don't, easily send it back!
summary: I had bought one before this one and it was fine when I got it

reviewText: Gorgeous swimming suit.  Fits perfectly and hides the stomach area very well.
I am 5'7, 125 pounds, 34b. Ordered size Small and it fit pretty well. The material quality isn't the best, but you do get what you pay for. Good deal for the price.

This is a beautiful suit! I ordered an XL (6-8) after reading many reviews. I had a hard time reconciling a 6-8 being an XL but, tape measure in hand, I did my measurement checks and hit 'checkout'. I received the suit 3 days later and eagerly tried it on. The 2-tone white on black is absolutely beautiful. The white material is heavy enough to not become see-through when wet and the padded cups, while being movable pads, are large enough to place where they do the most good! I am rather small, but coverage & support is there for considerably larger gals. I wondered if the halter ties at the neck and the mid-back might be a bit much, but they are actually not as big as they appear in the picture and don't distract at all from the suit. I tied the halter and used the back ties to snug up the sides of the suit. The black material fits nicely at the back and over the hips. The halter ties allow a bit of adjustment to the torso length, but even tied as tightly as possible, the bottom didn't ride up and was comfortable. I have a fairly long torso so I'm certain this suit wouldn't be a problem in that area for anyone else. Now to what I feel is the most helpful to you-my statistics! I am 5'7", 140#s, 36" (A-cup), 29" waist, 38" hips. I usually wear a size 6 or 8 pant, a size S sweater, M tee shirt, size 10 shirt and a M/8 dress-(unless it's a really form fitting jersey or ponte knit, then I order a L).
Anyway, this is a really beautiful suit and for the price you can't go wrong as long as you measure and don't get thrown by the wacky sizing!
summary: Can't believe this suit looks SO good for so little money!!

reviewText: A few months in the gym and this will be my favorite bathing suit.
