Not the best for small chested ladies.....
I'm 5'3" and 136lbs. I have a pear shape.....larger rear and thighs, and smaller waist/chest......so I ordered the XL. I worried it'd be WAY too big and when I opened it, it looked like it was going to be, but when I put it on, it wasn't that bad. It fit my butt and thighs just fine. And because I have a small chest (36A or 32C, depending on what bra I use), the top is a bit big and I had to kind of tie the back before clasping the clip to make it tighter. I wish it was a TIE, not a clasp, but oh well. I also added an extra pad from one of my Gene bras to help fill it a bit more lol. Very cute suit! I know that if I had gotten the L, the butt would have been too tight and it probably wouldn't' have covered enough of it. So. other than the top being a bit big, it's still a great fit.
summary: Not the best for small chested ladies

reviewText:
This is a nice quality swimsuit-- thick enough, not see-through, and does a good job of accentuating the positives and hiding little imperfections. Going by another reviewer of similar height and weight (I'm 5'4" and 126 pounds), I ordered the XL, which was fine, but the keyhole part doesn't lie flat on my body. I think this is a bust issue... I'm very big busted and that can make things fit oddly! The keyhole puckers outward for me and looks very strange, so I'm passing this along to someone who can make better use of it.

reviewText:
I love Darn Tough socks. Can't recommend them enough! I've gotten many people to buy them and they are all thrilled with their purchases. These particular socks are a good height for a regular 5 inch hiking boot without any sock sticking out and no skin-to-not contact. They are comfortable, don't stretch, and have the best warranty in the business. Since they are made with merino wool, they keep you warm in the winter, cool in the summer, and don't sink! In fact, I've worn them for 5 consecutive days without regretting it.

I would definitely buy these again and would recommend them to a friend.
summary: Darn Tough to say no to

reviewText: Beautiful necklace, crafted very well. Its is NOT fake gold like I orginally assumed. Ive gotten a few compliments. I love it!

This strapless lace flare dress is simply adorable. I chose the black lace dress with a nude underlay. The lace overlay is thick and super soft. The top has a sweetheart neckline underneath. The lace overlay is sewn around the sweetheart neckline and around to the back. The lace also attaches to both sides of the top area. The lace on the bottom is free flowing and is not attached to the underlay.

There is a loop string on both side of the dress to hold the ribbon. The ribbon can be tied in the front or back. You can also remove the ribbon if needed. The loops on the side blend in with the dress so its not noticeable.

The back of the dress has a 22 metal zipper with a metal pull. The zipper blends in well with the dress. With the long zipper, this allows you to step in and out of the dress without the hassle of having to pull it over your head.

Measurements of XL

Bust: 19 across

Waist: 18 across

Length: 41 long

These are approximate measurements while lying flat. This material does have a small amount of stretch to it.

There are 3 adorable colors to choose from. This dress would be great to wear to a wedding, funeral, parties, on a cruise and more. I am really impressed with how soft the material is. Its very comfortable to wear all day long. You will feel absolutely gorgeous in this dress! I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
summary: Adorable Sleeveless Soft Lace Overlay Dress with a Cute Sweeheart Neckline

reviewText: One of my favorite aspects about this dress is the length.  I love dresses, they are so comfortable and classy, but I often find that they are made to come above the knee.  I love that on me, this dress falls about mid calf.  I think that that is a perfect length and it is appropriate for any event whether it be more casual or dressy.  The slip under the lace if very comfortable and soft.  The lace is gorgeous!  Very intricate and such a beautiful pattern.  It is sturdy and well done, not easily frayed or pulled.  The top of the dress if fitted to the waist and then flows down loosely from there.  The waist features a long ribbon that decorates the waist nicely when tied into a bow.  The neck is a sweetheart neckline that accentuates the chest area very well and gives this dress an even more feminine and elegant feel.  I really like the high neckline with the lace.  It is a conservative dress without being too conservative with the see through chest and upper back.  The back features a zipper that goes down to about the hip area.  It is a high quality zipper that moves easily.  This is a beautiful dress that compliments the body very well!  It would be great for just about any occasion.  I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This is a very beautiful dress in person and is photograph true to color and style. I choose the navy color and it's quite beautiful. The construction as far as the zipper and seams goes was great. However the belt holder (super thin string) was broken when I received it. No problem though it's just what holds the ribbon in place, and still looks great and works perfect despite the broken loop. You just tie the ribbon a little tighter. The fit was true to size as mediums generally fit well through my waist but a little tight on the bust since I have a larger chest. I'm 5'9" and the length was good as well. I did receive this product at a discounted rate for my unbiased review but I never promise a positive review only and honest one.

Great stretchy summer dress. Material is not sheer, there's a slip built in that meets the entire length of the dress.

reviewText: This dress is absolutely gorgeous in person! I was worried buying a dress from a designer I am not familiar with on Amazon, but I could not b any more pleased with how it looks! The fit is spot on for me, and the dress is very flattering empire waisted with a cute ribbon belt to further accent your waist. The lace fabric looks just gorgeous over the nude colored interior fabric. I also liked that this dress is all one piece. I've purchased other dresses in this similar style with black lace and the under part frequently comes as a separate slip. This was easy to zip up and put on, and I got a lot of compliments on the dress! I love that it can be used for just about any season. For this particular event I paired it with a black cardigan since it is colder, but it could easily be worn simply in its' sleeveless form. Cannot recommend this dress enough. I f you are on the fence about how it will look or if the quality isn't good, please let my review assure you that it is worth the purchase! I am definitely not a tiny little girl who can wear anything, either. I'm average/curvy build and tall, and the dress was still flattering.
summary: Absolute favorite dress I have ever ordered online!

I will note that, in white, the dress is somewhat see-through so you will need to wear nude colored undergarments and/or a slip under it.  Also, you will need either a strapless bra or clear bra straps because of the see-through lace at the top of the dress.

I personally didn't care for the ribbon sash so I opted not to wear it, but thats just personal preference.

Bottom line - I would recommend this dress to anyone who wants to look like a million bucks but only spend $30!

Due to living in a rural area, the options for a wedding dress to fit my specific needs - simple, non-fussy, inexpensive, comfortable, and flattering on a plus-size frame - were extremely limited. After an extensive search across several Internet sites, ordering and rejecting many dresses, and with less than a month to go before my wedding, I came across this dress on Amazon. I ordered it out of desperation and kept my fingers crossed that this would finally be "the one." Imagine my amazement when I tried it on - not only did it fit, it fulfilled my wildest dreams! It is comfortable, very easy to accessorize, and is very flattering on this 200-lb. lady (I bought the XX-Large Plus). I also bought a Dresstells Women's Vintage Rockabilly Petticoat Skirt Tutu 1950s Underskirt White L-XL to wear underneath it to poof out the skirt and give a more flattering silhouette. It was perfect for the casual, outdoor wedding my new hubby and I held in our back yard. And how about this: No ironing required! It comes folded up in a small plastic bag, so I expected I'd need to press it before our big day. When I received it I shook it out, tried it on, fell in love with it, then hung it up and never touched it again until my wedding day. That was it. This would be a great dress to pack for a flight! Pros: Comfortable; lightweight; stretchy fabric; simple to accessorize with rhinestone and pearl jewelry; no ironing needed. Cons: VERY thin (undergarments should be nude-colored to prevent them showing through); be wary of any rings or bracelets you may be wearing, as they can snag on the soft lace overlay (it's almost like some lace curtain fabrics); and it definitely is NOT white but ivory in color. The only reason why I give this dress 4 rather than 5 stars is that is definitely NOT white in color as stated in the description, but IVORY. I was very disappointed by that, but found that could live with it because otherwise this dress was just what I wanted!

reviewText:
So, I have put on quite some weight since last year and I wasn't sure that this was going to fit be right. I worried that because the dress hangs without any poof that my less-than-attractive muffin top would show through but honestly, this dress covers up just about everything! The dress is VERY heavy duty. I wear a lot of rings and they have scratched over the lace about a dozen times and has not frayed or damaged it in any way. The zipper is very well made as well, which is super important to me. Above all else, this dress is so comfortable. It's soft without being delicate and doesn't constrict you like a snake.

I am using this as my wedding dress. My fiance and I are having a cute private ceremony on the beach so, short was ideal but not so short that it is like a homecoming dress. I'm 5' 11" and about 270lbs and this dress hangs juuuuuust above the knee cap for me. I will post a photo after my wedding (superstitious family, blah blah) to show you all what it looks like.

I'd also like to add that I added a small tulle layer to the bottom of the dress just because I wanted a little extra fluff to it. I found that using a petticoat underneath was too much for it. If nothing else, wear a tulle slip under it or do what I did with adding the tulle lip under the last 6 inches of the dress. it makes ALL of the difference!
summary: Perfect for just about any event! Bought a size 3XL.

Pros: Very high-quality, excellent materials in general and very well-made.
Cons: Pretty pricey, but not unreasonably so given the limited market; trim around bill could ideally be a little heavier.

This cap looks completely insane on me and I feel like a total fool wearing it. In other words, it's absolutely perfect! I was looking for something to help me stand out a bit this year as I do my volunteer parade-marshal gig in our town's Holiday Parade, and this really fits the bill, so to speak. :)

The cap is very well-made, as high a quality as I've ever seen in any baseball-style cap. The 100% cotton material is quite heavy, backed by fabric interfacing at the front to help maintain shape. The pom pom on top is very substantial. The white trim around the bill is adequate, though it's the one thing that could ideally be a little heavier, but nevertheless looks good as is.

The cap is plenty large, fitting my 7-1/4" head size without any problem at all, with lots of adjustment left to go bigger or smaller. The bill is quite large, with the trim making it seem even larger, so you'll certainly have no issues with shading your eyes.

It is definitely quite pricey, but I don't think it's out of line considering that it must be a fairly small-quantity item for the maker since it's so specific to the time of year. And it's going to last for years. In my case, I wouldn't have been happy with a lower-quality item, so I'm very content with my purchase.

I was participating in a Santa Run 5K and was looking for the perfect cap to go with the sunny Santa suit provided by the event. This is exactly how I pictured the cap in my mind.  I tried a several searches on Amazon, but didn't see this one in my search results.  I then went to retail stores. Still couldn't find the perfect cap.  As I was leaving WalMart, I finally found it...but it was on the head of another WalMart customer. She told me she bought it on Amazon.  I told her I had searched Amazon, but didn't see it. She then pointed out the website embroidered in red thread on the back of her cap.  Success! The cap came in just enough time for the Santa Run. The cap is well made and very comfortable. I was concerned that red colored sweat might drip down my forehead during the 5K, but I'm happy to report that my perspiration did not cause the color to bleed.

I am 5'6" about 140-145 lbs and normally wear a US size 6 or 8.  I ordered a size 8.  If you decide to order this dress, please order a size or 2 larger than you normally wear.

It will cost upwards of $100 to send back to return, so I'm giving this to my niece.

reviewText: Love, love, love these pants.  Will order again.  They are long in the leg (must wear heels) and that is ok with me.  If I want to wear flats, I can easily hem these.  It is so hard to find quality knit pants and these are the best.

I will wear these on a regular basis around the house and out while running quick errands.  I love the pocket in the waistband as I can carry my cell phone in it!

Falls beautifully off the derriere and full enough to have a smooth line all the way to the heel. Very pleased, hoping there are other colors available? I'd love some in navy or a dark sage...

Love the length, style, material. Very comfortable. I am 5'7" and have an hourglass figure. Finding pants is difficult for me because of my hips. These pants are a perfect fit. I got an XL just in case the pants ran small but it is true to size.

I liked the material of these pants (bamboo), so with Amazon's excellent clothing return policy I took a chance with them.  They are easily six inches too long for my 5'3" height, but I'm used to hemming pants, so that's not too big a deal.  I love weight and drape of the pant.  They definitely hug my curves, but they don't show lumps and bumps and they fall as nicely as seen in the picture.  I'd say they'd do well casually and also on an evening out. On me they are a bit too body conscious for work wear, but your mileage may vary.  They remind me of the kind of pants from a popular mall store I used to wear in the late 1990s that I haven't been able find in the past fifteen years.  Better fabric though--the bamboo should be breathable. Solid buy.
Women's Universal pants are well-made and comfortable.  I love the bamboo fabric because it wears beautifully and it's so soft.  A good investment in your casual wardrobe..
summary: Well made, soft and comfy and a good value.

Very nice pants and pretty much perfect! The fabric is substantial and silky soft!

While they fit well, the large pair's drape started right at my hips (saddle bags) and "poofed out" a little bit -- the extra fabric was not flattering. BUT the medium pair fit really well! I usually wear 8-10 in pants and am about 5' 8". The length is really nice for a tall person. I would recommend these for those looking for a wide-leg pant with a nice drape. Very happy so far!

reviewText:
I recently bought from another vendor a similar watch band. Unfortunately, that band's cheap 'metal' buckle gave way only 3 wks after I first put it on my wrist - (Synthetic Leather Strap - Barron Watch Company - it had over 150 reviews).
So I had to re-order another watch band and decided on this one as a replacement. One major difference I noticed immediately was the thicker, stronger buckle and D-rings. The leather of this watch is similar to the one I had to replace - except this band has a rough (unfinished) inner side - that however, takes nothing away from the quality, look or comfort. I'm very satisfied so far.....as an aside - this band's lenght is slightly longer then my previous one...by about a 1/ 2 of an inch.
summary: Good Value -  price / quality. Strong buckle and D-rings

reviewText: Works well with Seiko Astron GPS Solar!
Perfect to recharge solar watches....a must have item for solar watch owners.
Does a great job of charging my Citizen Eco Drive watch. I placed it on the charger before going to bed and it was fully charged in the morning.

So, this seemed like a silly thing to buy for my partner's solar watch.  But, he had problems keeping his prior solar watch charged (which was weird because I had the same watch and it was never a problem - I think it's him bleeding off the charge :) ).  He likes to wear his watch all the time unless he is showering so maybe that is an issue with the battery charge - I don't know.  In any case, I got this little LED charger (basically a bright flashlight in a stable setting) for him, and he has been delighted with it.  While it is really just a flashlight, it would be difficult to keep your watch on top of an upended flashlight so this design works very well.  Two little silicone cups are provided for watches of different sizes.  It's small and has worked very well so far.
summary: Nice little stable charger if you live somewhere it's often gray.

reviewText: If you have a solar watch this is for you. Quick and easy to use.
I like it....

Just arrived in the mail today. Tried it out. Impressive, and very bright. I am sure it will charge the watch as like under sun light. With a Lumins meter I measured about 320 to 350 Lumins at 1 Meter distance. The watch when directly on top of this LED light source it is receiving about 40,000 Lumens as like the instructions indicates. This is a very strong light source. It appears to be putting out very little heat of any, and thus very safe for the solar watch.

I suggest to not stare in to this light source with your eyes. It is a very strong concentrated blue-white light source. It is very effective for charging the solar watches. I am running this unit from a spare USB3 port on my computer.  It appears to be working with most any standard USB charger unit for phones or tablets. I like the idea that it can be used as a flashlight with 2 X AAA batteries. It will work as if you have a 320 Lumins flashlight which is fairly bright.

I am very satisfied with this LED Solar Watch Charger.
summary: Solar Watch LED Light Source Fast Charger

Works as expected. I wish the base was heavier. Its so light that the cord will cause it not to sit flat and it won't stay on a smooth surface. The weight of the cord will pull it off a dresser if not positioned carefully. Adding a watch doesnt help. Other than that it works as expected and seems to be charging Citizen Eco-Drive watches without getting them hot at all.

About the only non-positive thing I can say about this is that you really *shouldn't* need one. The whole point of a solar watch is that you don't have to worry about the battery. However, life isn't perfect. Sometimes in the winter with less light and longer sleeve clothing my watch battery meter ticks below the full reading. Or, sometimes I don't wear a watch for a while, forget to put it in the windowsill, and the light in the room just wasn't enough to keep it fully charged. When this happens I would normally put it in the windowsill for a day or so, or perhaps under a lamp by my desk. That's fine but this product does a better and faster job. It runs off of a usb port (no wall adapter is included, you need to supply your own or plug it into you PC or something.) It can also run off of two AAA batteries but then it only runs at half brightness, I don't really see the point of running of AAA batteries (might as well just get a watch with a battery in the first place :)) but it certainly doesn't hurt to have that option. In any case, great product that does exactly what it says.

reviewText: This is just what the doctor ordered.  I have two solar watchers but don't wear them at times.  With this machine I can give them a quick ten minute zap and Im set to go.  Great device, great job

The charger arrived in a huge Amazon box which did not fit in my mailbox. So much for that.

The product itself comes in a small white cardboard box. It is compact, lightweight, features a very long detachable USB cable which one can connect either to a laptop/PC USB port or to an individual USB power supply (not included). You can also insert 3 AAA batteries to operate it as some kind of light source, but then only 4 out of the 22 LEDs are lit in battery mode. If you want to charge solar watches, you must connect it to USB. There is a slider switch on one side to select either USB or battery mode.

Two rubber rings for two different sizes of solar watches are included. They hold the watch and prevent the bright light from filling the whole room. An easy to read user guide (in paper form!) comes with it. I have not yet tested it fully with my Casio Pro Treks, but I am pretty sure that my watches will prefer the cold LED light to the hot sunlight which I used up to now.
Charges my watch in half the time

This is a small but very bright LED lamp. It runs rather cool. The rubber ring around the light protects the watch crystal from scratching, and can do a very effective job of charging a solar-powered watch. The USB connector cable provided allows the watch to be charged from a computer, or (if connected to a (not supplied) 120 volt adapter) from wall current. It is simple and effective. If your normal watch use doesn't tend to keep your solar watch charged, or if you run your watch down, this lamp is exactly what you need.
summary: A useful tool for charging solar-powered watches

reviewText: About a month ago I bought a Citizen Eco Drive watch with RC atomic time.  The day it arrived I had the good fortune of it being the brightest day where I live in 6 months.  My watch was clicking at 2 second intervals, meaning it was on low power.  After 3 hours outdoors in the sun it moved to the middle power reserve bar and the seconds started ticking every second... I was then able to force an atomic time sync.  Over the next month I wore the watch every day intentionally ensuring it was facing light... but power reserve remained in the middle.  I then put the watch under an LED lamp... 5 inches away for 2 days in a row, 8 hours each day.  The reserve went to full power, but an hour later I checked again and it was back to medium power.  Finally I bought this device... 3 hours in and the watch was on full power and was staying there... but I'm going to give it a 12 hour charge today and then follow what others do and charge it 6 more hours every following month whether it needs it or not.  This charger will allow me to be not obsessed with making sure my Eco Drive watch is always poking our from under my sleeve to grab light.
summary: Great Eco Drive Accessory to get full power reserve

reviewText:
I received my Amazon order for two of these chargers and I immediately tried them out.  Each one can be powered in three ways:

1.  Mini USB cable.
2.  4.5 V DC power supply.
3.  2 AAA batteries.

When you use the AAA batteries, only four of the LEDs will light up.  I don't know how well the four LEDs charge a solar watch because I only tested my chargers with the batteries to make sure that the battery terminals were making good contact.  I never ran them for any length of time with the AAA batteries.  For the long term test, I powered my two chargers with one of these Vivitar USB chargers that has two 2 A USB outputs:

https://www.amazon.com/dp/B005GCMYAG/ref=cm_cd_asin_lnk

Note that if you plan on getting a dual USB output charger similar to what I bought, look carefully at the current output through the two USB ports.  I found that most of the units do not have a full 2 A output from both USB ports.  Most of them have 2 A from one and 1 A from the second one.  Ideally, you want as much current as possible (2 A) from both USB ports.  The Vivitar one that I mentioned above was one of the few with that option.  Despite what the Amazon reviewers said, I have had absolutely no problems with the one that I bought.

The solar watch LED chargers are made from very thin black plastic and they are very light weight.  I would not even think about taking them on vacation with me because I don't think that they'd survive bouncing around in a suitcase.  They are plenty durable enough for what I intend to do with them though - sit on my dresser and charge up my Casio, Seiko, and Citizen solar watches once a month.

I put two of my most favorite Citizen Eco Drive dive watches on the new chargers: my Eco Zilla and my Promaster Aqualand Depth Meter diver.  Both watches rested on top of the chargers' rubber bezels without extending beyond the bezels' outer edges.  The chargers' rubber bezels are great because they did not scratch my watch bezels.  The LED chargers worked great!  I have never run my solar watch batteries down very far (that will shorten the life of them) but my depth meter dive watch has a power reserve meter on it and it was down to about 75% charge before I started my test.  After about three hours on the LED charger, the meter was up to a full 100%.

Even though my two watches were fully charged up, I decided to leave them on the LED chargers for a full 24 hours.  After sitting on the chargers for the full 24 hours, my watches were only a little bit warm and not dangerously so.  This is a major benefit to using these LED chargers versus leaving solar watches on a windowsill where they can really cook.  Also, unlike sunlight, LEDs do not give out UV light so they will not fade watch dials and hands.  Fading hands is a big problem with some Citizen Eco Drive dive watches with bright orange minute hands if they are left on a windowsill repeatedly for recharging.

The chargers come with two different sized rubber bezels.  Supposedly one is for woman's watches and one is for men's watches.  I only used the larger one for men's watches and it worked just fine.  It was able to accommodate both my largest watch (the 50 mm Aqualand Depth Meter BN2021-03E diver that I ran my first test on) and my smallest watch (a 40 mm Citizen BN0000-04H diver.)  Both fit just fine though the larger watch rested on the highest top surface of the rubber bezel, while the smaller one fit down low inside the bezel on its sloped/inclined surface.  All of my other solar powered watches in between those sizes fit just fine on the chargers.

When resting my large Aqualand Depth Meter and Eco Zilla watches on the chargers, the bumps on the surfaces of the bezels caused the bezels to not sit 100% flush against the chargers' rubber bezels all the way around.  Those gaps between the watch bezels and charger bezels let some of the light from the LEDs shine out and into my bedroom.  My wife complained about the light on the ceiling last night when she was first went to bed but after she shut her eyes, she fell asleep in a few minutes.  She slept just fine throughout the night so the light spilling out from the chargers may seem like a lot at first, but once you close your eyes you won't notice it.  My smaller watches like the 40 mm Citizen diver I mentioned before that fit within the bezel did not have nearly as much light spill out.  Also, in theory, a watch bezel that is perfectly smooth will rest completely flush against the charger bezel and prevent any light from shining out and into the room.  None of my solar watches have smooth bezels so I did not get the chance to test out that theory.

So I give these little solar watch chargers two thumbs up.  For what they are, they're not the cheapest things out there, but if they keep my solar watch batteries from going dead and keep my watch hands and dials from fading, they're a great buy.

Some of the negative comments/reviews for these solar chargers say to just leave solar watches on a window sill to recharge them.  Here is my reply to that idea:

Putting a solar watch on a window sill exposes it to lots of UV light. That harsh UV light can fade the dial and hands if they are brightly colored, as are the minute hands on several of my solar diving watches. There are pictures on the internet of badly faded dive watch dials and hands from people that made the mistake of using a window sill to recharge their watches. Unlike sunlight, LEDs like what are used in this charger do not give out a lot of UV light (some sources say that LEDs do not put out any UV light) and thus they will not fade anything that they illuminate. Also, if you have a Citizen Eco Drive watch, the instructions clearly state to avoid charging the watch in an area that becomes hot like a car dashboard. A window sill in direct sunlight can easily become just as hot as a dashboard. Too much heat is not good for the movement in solar watches.

Of course, you can just wear a solar watch to recharge it (unless you're nocturnal) but when you're a watch collector, usually you have too many watches in your collection and your solar ones only come up in the rotation every few months at most. As a result they don't get the necessary wrist time to sufficiently keep their batteries fully charged between the times that they are worn.  Letting solar watch batteries die repeatedly will drastically shorten their life.  As others have found out the hard way, these chargers will not fix a completely dead rechargeable battery in a solar watch.

I used the large rubber adapter for the Pro Trek which was the correct size and it kept the watch from being in direct contact with the glass covering the light.  Again, if it holds up over time, the cost not to have to worry about any hassles keeping my solars on full charge will be worth it.  I will probably never use it with batteries nor use it as a flashlight.  I have numerous flashlights and numerous USB charging stations.  However, other than that, it does the job it's meant to do and seems to do it well.

reviewText:
I have 2 new Casio solar watches. They either came fully charged or at medium charge, and a full afternoon of bright sunshine on my windowsill and they were fully charged. I expect the new watches will stay fully charged for months w/o need of a recharge.
However, I bought this LED charger "just in case". I did test it to ensure that all of the individual LED lights came on, and I also put each watch atop the lights to check for proper fit and to test that the watches did not overheat. No problems with the lights, the fit or overheating.
What I could not determine is whether this device can actually charge my watches since they were already fully charged. I'll accept on faith what other reviewers reported, which is they do work well as a charger, but will provide an update, if I experience differently.
Rubber ring that the watch face sits on does a well enough job of blocking the light so as not to disrupt you while you're sleeping should you choose to use this in the same room you sleep in.

I have several solar powered watches and this gadget works great to recharge them. I bought a Casio Solar that was just about dead and in a few hours this thing charged it to full and it has stayed there. If you have solar watches buy this!!
works great!
Love this item!  Works perfectly charging my solare watches.

This works great.  I have a Casio solar watch and it charged it to 100% in just a few hours.  It should work well with my Citizen's watch as well.  Because I work in an office I don't always get the proper amount of light it needs.  So this does this job!

What it is not. Let's get one thing straight. 30k lux is not "similar to direct summer sunlight". Summer sunlight would be more in the 45k-55k lux range. It's not a "precision" device.. rather.. lightweight plastic. What you might expect in a childrens toy from the dollar store. It's not heat free. (It's not the LED's that produce heat, but rather the resistors and control circuits driving the LED's that create heat.) That just goes to the overall lack of quality in the product.

What it is. The only viable/convenient/versatile solution for solar watch charging on the market.. IT WORKS.. it works extremly well.. and is very affordable when considering cost/benefit. While less than "direct summer sunlight".. it is constant available light 24/7, several times more powerful than sun through a window and exponentially more powerful than a standard light bulb.

Let me stress "constant". Providing a constant rate of charge will prolong the life of your watches power supply.

Does it need to be a precion instrument? No. Once your watch is fully charged it likely won't be used again more than once every few months.
Does the heat generated harm a solar watch in any way? No.

Observations: As mentioned by others, the bezel pads leave a little to be desired. Even with my mid-large sized Protrek, it's a balancing act. One additional smaller and one additional larger pad would be nice to see.

Battery compartment. It wasn't mentioned in the description, but was a very nice surprise to see the 2xAAA capability. No need for cords, adapters or battery brick while camping/travelling.

Overall? MORE than worth the price tag. It does what it's supposed to do. It does it well. Providing a constant charge source and prolonging the life of my watches power supply alone pays for itself. Even if this one were to fail I would purchase another.
summary: What it is and is not.

reviewText:
Casio Solar, Citizen Eco Drive, Seiko Solar Watch Charger! CoolFire Professional Solar Watch Charger
I wish I had researched this when I bought my watch several years ago. It must have never been fully charged from the time it was shipped. It seemed like it was always showing a medium or low charge in the winter - or if my sleeve covered it for a day. I compensated. I kept my sleeve above the watch, I sat it in the window in full sunshine. In the summer it typically showed a full charge after a day outside but it just didn't last.

CoolFire to the rescue! On the day I received it, I sat my watch on it overnight. It didn't synchronize the time (I usually set it on a brass lamp that seems to act like a receiving antenna.) but in the morning it showed a full charge.  Being a bit skeptical, I charged it overnight the next night as well.  I haven't used the CoolFire again and my watch is still showing a full charge. I haven't worried about my sleeves. It does the trick! I have the CoolFire in a standby-ready state in the nightstand drawer.

The charger comes with two adapters to fit the watch face size. The large one worked fine with mine. I positioned it near my bed and was not bothered at all by a very minimal light leak which I was able to "aim" away from me. The only negative I not is that it only comes with a USB power cord. You must supply the outlet adapter or plug it into a computer USB port.

The picture shows my typical charge state post-summer - sometimes lower as summer fades farther into the past.

reviewText: I'm kind of a gadget guy and I buy lots and lots of things that sound like good deals but are, in reality, fairly useless.  I'm a watch nut and I currently possess about 15 solar powered watches (among a total of 150 watches), and since I generally never wear the same watch more than once in a month or two,  my solar watches drain and go dead sitting in a darkened closet over a long period of non-use.  Like other watch collectors,  I've periodically taken my box of solar watches and cooked them on the patio for a day, but I sometimes forget.  What I like about this device is that it can be used to 'jump-start' a solar watch.  I place the watch on this device face-down, get ready for the day,  and by the time I head out the door about an hour later,  there's enough power to see me through the morning.  And as the day goes on, the watch continues to charge.  I've also placed two of these devices on top of the watch box face down (that is, pointing toward the faces of the dozens of watches inside the watch box) and after a few hours, all of the watches inside have enough juice to power them for weeks.  This is a lot simpler and more secure than toting the box downstairs and leaving them outside where they may be easily stolen.  I suppose you could perform the same tasks with a standard flashlight, but I believe these devices are optimized for the light wave length to which the watches best respond.  Pricey?  Maybe.  But aren't you worth it?

Received it with my Prime account in 2 days. It's a very simple device that comes with 2 rubber adapters to use depending on the face size of your watch. It's powered by a USB cord or batteries. It took about 3hrs of charging to bring my ProTrek to full charge and the watch has maintained that level ever since. Will I use this product often? No, But if you don't use your watch for extended periods and the charge gets low, this is great product to quickly bring your watch up to a full charge.  Although the product looks fragile and may not survive a drop from a table, if you take care of it, I think it should last a long time.

Now I have a rotation for all my solar watches on this solar watch charger.  It is far easier and more consistent than my trucks dashboard. reviewText: I love my Citizen Eco Drive and Casio Tough Solar watches. The batteries last a very long time even with little light. Unfortunately in Michigan the watch is under a sleeve 3 seasons of the year and the northern sun doesn't give much help. I've sat my watches for days at a time in the window sill during fall to spring and it didn't help much. But this little changer is GREAT! I used it on my nearly dead Eco Drive Skyhawk and it had a full change in 18 hours (which is good) and that will easily last well into summer from the one charge. The charger is very small and can use a USB (2.0 probably), batteries, or a female DC power source. It comes with 2 shades for male and female watches so not much light gets past. The light is very bright for obvious reasons but the little unit stays cool. If you have solar watches that aren't what little light they need to keep a strong charge this thing really helps. Solar watches don't need much sun to keep them running but once the battery is drained too much they can take a while to charge especially in the winter. This is much better than setting you items on a window sill or the dashboard of your car in hopes of getting power. Going to loan it to a coworker who's on night shifts. I know buying a plug-in device to solar charge something seems counter productive but whatever. Great charger, tiny, power efficient, and time and effort saving. ZERO NEGATIVE FEEDBACK.
summary: Very happy! Charges my solar watches fast and easy. 100% satisfied!

reviewText:
I live in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada where its rainy and overcast for 80% of the year. I needed a little oomph for my Casio Protrek watch which had dipped to dangerously low power levels. I read the reviews on this unit and finally pulled the plug. The light came packaged nicely, and shipping was quick thanks to Prime.

I must agree with a lot of the reviews out there. This unit feels cheap, looks cheap, and is grossly overpriced.  Having said that.......it does EXACTLY what its supposed to do. I placed my Protrek on this unit overnight and by morning it had a High charge and has remained that way every since. I used a Samsung phone charger instead of the provided cord and it worked perfectly. My watch was warm to the touch after 12 hours on charge but nothing that would case me concern. I would EASILY pay double this price for a better built light made out of aluminium or metals. My plan is to top up the charge whenever it dips to Medium....for that purpose this unit is excellent. I had no burnt out lights and it was blinding bright.

The unit is so light that it only lays flat when the watch was placed on it as a weight. I haven't found anything else like it so for now.....this unit has a monopoly on the aftermarket solar watch charging market.

1 Star deduction for being overpriced and feeling cheaply made.

A solar-powered watch may seem like the best option for many, but it isn't if you can't give your watch five, six or more hours of direct, full sun each month, without frying the battery. A watch covered by a long sleeve doesn't receive sufficient energy for charging, even if you are out in full sunshine. Indoor lighting and sunshine through windows don't provide anywhere near the energy provided by direct full sunshine. If you leave your watch out in the full sun and the watch heats near or above 140F, the battery may degrade.

So, I ordered this solar watch recharger. It seems to work well. Although after two-hours, my eco-drive watch was warm. I let the watch cool before doing more charging.

This device is rated at 40,000 lux. Full sunlight lux varies, but 98,000 lux is a good standard. Therefore, if your solar watch requires six hours of full sun to run for 30 days, you may need to charge your watch on this device for roughly 15 hours, more or less depending on the watch's battery reserve.

reviewText:
This helpful device brought my Citizen Eco-Drive Chronograph back to life quicker than any other method might have, however, in the process it almost became a fire hazard. I had the AC port hooked up to a surge protector and unfortunately soon after the the charger started making a burning smell. I quickly unplugged it and let it sit for a bit, luckily no more damage was done than about 3 of the lights no longer working. Afterwards, I used the cell-phone charger port for the remainder of my charging and my Citizen came back to life within a day.

As a whole, I would recommend the charger for anyone that wants to expedite charging on a solar or Eco-Drive watch, however, I would STRONGLY recommend that you do not use the AC port considering that it could possibly be a fire hazard which is why I docked an additional star. As a matter of fact, I would also advise that if the manufacturer reads this, they discontinue having this port available altogether as I'd rather have no AC port than one that risks burning your house down!
summary: Nothing like this out there, but DO NOT use the AC port!!!

reviewText: GREAT PRODUCT

When I bought my Citizen Eco-Drive solar-powered watch, I failed to realize just how much of the year my watch is under a jacket or a sweater sleeve. Inevitably, the watch runs out of power a few times per year, and resetting an Eco-Drive watch is a surprisingly involved task. Of course I first need to recharge the watch, but with an interior office and limited sunlight at home during the winter, setting the watch out in the sun for a few hours was not an option. I actually resorted to haunting my watch inside the fluorescent light fixture in the ceiling of my office, but even then it would take a couple of days for the watch to fully recharge.

It may feel a bit counterproductive to use electricity to recharge a solar watch - after all, the whole idea of a solar watch centers on ecology, but this device uses ultra-efficient LEDs and it plugs into as standard USB port. Plugged into an unused port on a computer, the power draw is minuscule, and yet it can recharge an Eco-Drive watch in a matter of hours. This is sort of like having an electric watch wonder for an automatic watch, but far more energy efficient.
summary: A little bit of sunshine for solar watches

Unit works well on my Citizen, Seiko and Casio Solar Powered watches, including my Citizen Satellite Wave (GPS) watch.
The watches do become warm after an hour sitting on the rubber supports but nowhere as warm as siting in direct sunlight (indirect sunlight is safer if exposed to sunlight.)
All my solar watches reside in glass topped cases and I use the unit upside down over 1 or 2 watches at a time, that way I avoid any warming of the watches at all. Another way is place the unit on it's side and lay the watch on it's edge about 1 inch from the light unit, with no warming at all.
It takes the unit about 2 minutes to get around 8 hours of charge into a typical solar watch, so 6 minutes for a day, 3 hours for a month.

After using it for about 2 weeks, I am, thus far, satisfied that the Solar Charger seems to be operating as expected.  I have only one Casio, Eco-Drive watch, but, the charger's 'Men's Watch Adapter' fits the face of my watch, perfectly. There are no leaks of light coming out from around the watch face. As to whether or not my watch is getting a full charge or not, I can't tell. There's not a 'Charge Indicator' on my watch.

If anything occurs to change my opinion, I'll update my review.  Like I said, I've only used it about 2 weeks.  Until then, for the money, I'd say this is a pretty good solar watch charger.
So far, so good!

Works very well. It also comes with rubber mounts around the light to fit your watches perfectly. There is no light leakage. It charged my Astron as fast as the sun does. Pretty impressive, I will update this if the LED's do not last.

I own several solar watches. This makes keeping them charged and topped up a breeze. Most of the Casio Tough Solar's I've gotten usually come at medium charge level, with some variance in exactly how charged they are. At best this has brought these new watches up to full in 2 hours, and at worst in about 6. It works great.

Terrific instrument. Shield it from your eyes, it lights up like the Crab Nebula. My Casio Wave Ceptor had been stored in a drawer while I was laid up for a number of months. This morning after three hours under this little Hummer, the Casio is back in operation. Earlier this month I stored it in direct sunlight three different times and thought it was gone. Happy to have found the Solar Charger.

For about $26 dollars the price is about right for this and the small footprint it takes.

reviewText:
I bought this along with a new watch to replace my old solar, which was on its second rechargeable battery and had again failed. In reviewing the manual for my new solar charging watch, I came to realize that I just was not reaching the minimum daily time in the sun or a bright light and the battery was running down over a few of years.

So after using this charger overnight to top off my new watch, I decided to see if I could invigorate my old, dead watch. I set it on the charger for a full day and not only did it appear fully restored, but the light was working again--this had stopped a few months after replacing the battery several years ago. Now I have two perfectly good solar watches!

The only (very minor) negatives are that the USB cable is relatively short (~ 3 ft) for where I want to use it, and even with the rubber gasket, enough light escapes out the sides to act as a nightlight.
summary: I wish I had known about this before buying a replacement watch

Why would you waste any money on this? A solar powered watch will maintain a charge from a lamp in your house! You don't even need sunlight to keep a good solar watch running - just light! And they will run for over a month in total darkness! I have three Citizen Eco Drives that have never needed any such contraption for charging. 100% a gimmick.

Also note that the other function of a solar watch is not only to tell time but to save batteries and energy. This is a device that wastes energy!

If you're seriously considering buying this for your solar watch - don't. Its a gimmick to make you think that you need it for some reason.

reviewText:
Awesome. Just awesome. I have a few solar watches and to be honest, they charge just fine. My Oceanus has never run low on charge even after sun deprivation...and I'm talking three months plus in a closed drawer. I pull it out and it springs to life. My Seiko Astron is another story. Got it fully charged and even with daily wear in sunny California it eventually dropped power until it wouldn't synchronize. Took a year and a half but it eventually happened. If I was outside frequently that would be a different story. But I'm not.  Bummer. These watches use a lot of power to synchronize with those pesky satellites. Leaving the watch in the sun heats it up unless it's strapped to your wrist to heat sink it. Plus it takes soooo long. This device fixes that. Easy to use and does a great job. As an engineer, I'm measuring all the necessary variables to see how good it works. Thus far, I can say it is brilliantly simple and easy to set up and use. It moved my Astrom from the third lowest charge to the second in 8 hours. It can now can talk to the satellites. It may be simple but it works. If you buy a solar power hog, you need this. Will update when I know more. I'm soooo happy right now I bought this life saver.
It took 3 days to get my Astron from the lowest setting to the highest. I will probably put the watch on one night a month and see how that goes. A great buy even if needed infrequently.
summary: Absolutely necessary for high end power guzzlers.

reviewText:
It works, yes, but is way over-priced for what it is... a few UV LED's.  I purchased this exact same unit from Deal-Extreme a couple years ago for < $3, and have used it twice.  Yes, it will charge your solar watch, but 2-3 DAYS on this unit is about the same as sitting your watch under a 60W incandescent desk-lamp for about 10-hours... or on a window-sill on a sunny day for about 2-3 hours!

Construction seems to be okay, it's not typical "Chinese-cheap", but it's not high-end either.  The LED's are very low-power, which is why they take forever to charge your watch, compared to REAL UV exposure, or a good desk-lamp.  It's a decent gimmick, and does actually work, but why pay $23-25 for a $2 anemic flashlight when you have the power of the sun for free... and who doesn't have a desk-lamp available to them already???
The product works exactly as advertised.  It is very convenient as I have several solar powered watches ann can make sure to keep them charged even when not in use.

I love watches. I also hate buying batteries.

Therefore, I resolved to only buy kinetic or solar timepieces.

Now, years later I have two kinetic watches and a dual watch winder.

But.......my six solar watches presented a challenge.  Rotate wear, put in window, etc. Still unsure they were all fully energized. This simple device and a once a month charging routine --- problem solved.

Clever, simple and relatively inexpensive.

Recommended for gift giving, or yourself!
summary: Great product for geeky watch lovers!

reviewText:
First, be aware that this item ships from overseas, so it will take a fair amount of time to reach you in the States. In my case, three weeks.

Second, this product is necessary, and works very well for its intended purpose.

I have a few solar watches. I am careful not to put them in a closed, dark drawer, and leave them out so that they can charge by the light of the room. For the most part, this has worked reasonably well.

Then I bought a high-end watch, with a large internal battery, and I found that a little exposure to room light wasn't cutting it. I tried leaving it in the bathroom with all the lights on full, and after a week, it hardly made a dent. Even worse, a little research revealed that with this particular watch, if it ever runs completely out of power it has to be sent in for servicing. (Yeah, I don't like that either, and I'm pretty sure it wasn't mentioned in the brochure.)

I go on Amazon, and find this little puppy. I ordered it, and when it (eventually) came, I plugged it in and put my watch face down on its rubber surface. Two days later, the giant battery showed half-full, which is a miracle, because a week in the bathroom didn't achieve that. A day or two later, and it was full.

No heat, lots of light that solar panels can effectively use, doesn't use much power, silent, won't scratch your watch, and relatively inexpensive.

What's not to like?

Seriously, if you are on the fence, just buy it. They could make it nicer, by putting it in a wooden case, adding fabric accents, a monogram, whatever. But, the basic functionality is there, and that's really all you need.

Recommended.

Sean Logue, 2015
summary: Great example of pure functionality. Does the job perfectly.

reviewText:
These are light weight, but not lite. I much prefer to use these over my standard vision glasses than to get another pair of expensive prescription sunglasses made. I usually only wear these for driving.

Update: I was wearing these for months before writing the review, and I am still using these. They are holding up well, meeting my needs and expectations. The bag they were shipped in is a material that works for buffing dust from the lenses. Polarized lenses typically make viewing some LCD readouts difficult (my car radio, for example) but flipping up the hinged lens for a quick peek then back into place is the least distracting way to learn what song or piece is playing (apart from not looking at all.)
Very functional, decent lens

Otherwise, they're excellent sunglasses and well worth buying if they'll fit your specs. If the nosepiece gets in the way of fitting over your specs, a couple of small screws can be removed with a jeweler's screwdriver, then remove the nosepiece and they fit over specs just fine.

reviewText: Purchased both the dark and bronze sunglasses during the Amazon Prime Day.  These are quality fit-over glasses that are a must if you do a lot of driving or spend a lot of time outdoors. I use the dark glasses on sunny days and the bronze (gunner) glasses on cloudy/rainy days.  I found the bronze glasses help me see better in cloudy or misty conditions.  People have asked me where i got them and refer them to the Amazon site.  I can highly recommend these to family and friends.

These glasses are just like typical over regular glasses sunglasses. What is so new unique and special though is that you can flip up the shades so you can read your odometer or your book when you need to.

More significantly, when people say it is low cut... at a C cup, it was so low that it was a little embarrassing, at least for me, but others who like to show a lot of cleavage might be okay with it.  Now that I'm a D cup, it just barely covers the nipples.  And I mean barely.  I've worn a black camisole underneath it, or a t-shirt on top, but that really shouldn't be necessary.  I should also warn that with one wash, the pattern on the bottom has already become noticeably faded.  I think it's very pretty to start with, but I think it will look very worn in just one or two more washes.

reviewText:
This is definitely a sexy sexy outfit! The lace on the bodice is very soft and even stretchy. The lace is delicate and adds some sensual sexiness to the outfit! It definitely goes down into a deep v on the front, but depending on your bust size, it will cover more or less. For me, it was pretty low on the front, but with the string on the halter, you can adjust it to make it a little more loose, or tighten it up so theres less give at the top.

There are tons of strings on the outfit, and it got kind of messy for me, because I was dressing myself. But if you get the halter tied on, when you go to put on the rest it is fine. The back of the outfit ties, (with the thin ribbon), but has enough (thick ribbon),  to tie around on the front. I do think that the thick ribbon piece looks better if it is tied around on the back, but that depends on if you have someone to tie it for you or if you can manage that on your own.

There are two pieces that go around your wrists, kind of like the cuffs on a traditional maids costume, if it was fully sleeved. They attach to each other or you can just tie the top in bows, but again, there is a lot string! That is the only downside to this outfit. The positive to this is that you can do whatever youd like when wearing it, because of all that string. I did not want my wrists or hands to be constricted so I did not tie them together. Tying them together adds a little bit of fun to your occasion, however.

The lace is not itchy, it is stretchy, and the ribbons are soft. I ordered a black color, but I did see that they offer a pink color as well. The black suits me so I am happy with this one. There is hardly any material on this sexy outfit, but it is good! I did not expect a covered up maid costume. Very sexy, and enjoyable in that it is flattering for me, I think it will be flattering for many people. I am 5 feet, with maybe two inches, and at 140 pounds, this makes me feel confident!

I swear by these since first using them during my time in the Navy. Uniform inspection was a breeze and I looked sharp when I wore my peanut butters. These Advanced ones are way better than the standard cloth and look like they'll last longer and retain their elasticity. Highly recommend stirrup style as it provides a more secure fit and less clips to deal with.

FOR CONCEALABLE BODY ARMOR: I highly recommend these. Depending on the location of where you clip these and the proper tension, you can avoid printing your concealable body armor vest under tucked uniform/buttoned down shirts. For example, attach the front clips more towards the sides, to provide you a bit of play with your shirt in the front to avoid printing the bottom-front-edge of your vest. YMMV, but shirt stays definitely give you more control and options - and most importantly, prevents your shirt from getting saggy and loose.
summary: A must have for concealable body armor.

reviewText: For years and years I have wondered why someone didn't come up with an invention to keep men's shirts tucked in their pants. I ran across these by happenstance on Amazon and immediately ordered a pair. The bottom line is that these work better than you could ever imagine. Admittedly, they are not very comfortable. You can feel them on the outside of your legs as you wear them and I can see how overtime they could rub the outside of your legs to the point of being sore.  I should admit, however, that I have only worn them twice so far, both times with fairly snug fitting jeans....I can imagine that they would likely be much more comfortable with a pair of men's dress slacks, so my comments shouldn't be construed as a negative.  My only concern is that the claws which grip the shirt are so strong and so effective at gripping the shirt that it would SEEM as though they could tear a hole in the shirt.  However, I can see no sign of this yet....this is pure speculation.  I can tell you that these work exactly as advertised and I plan to order a few more pairs of them, probably in one of their different configurations.  The ones I ordered have a stirrup that you put your foot through....the elastic then forks into two pieces which connect to two of the clamps which connect to the side and back of your shirt.  They also make some which connect to y Ur socks  which have the added advantage of holding your socks up while they keep your shirt pulled down.
summary: Shirt stays which absolutely work.  Very cool little gadget that  wish I had known about much sooner.

reviewText: I am 186 cm (6,1 ft) and these stays are too short for me. I've tried them with a quite long dress shirt with the straps stretched out at full length and the pull was excessive. So I do Like these.

They are not the best quality. You will have to sew them a few times. Hand sewing is not enough. you need to have a sewing machine. After about 2 months I had to restitch them, then they were fine. Pro Tip, Sew the foot straps on an angle and they will be more comfortable. You just need to use them on the same side every time.

You will also have to bend the clips every once in a while to get the tension back on the clips.

It can and will rip thin shirt material so be ware of that. Two shirts I love have holes now. To get around this fold over the bottom of the shirt at least once before inserting in the clip, This way you get more surface tension and the jaws won't just stretch it out as much.

Some shirt material will slip right out of the jaws. I its embarrassing to have one slip off when you are trying to pitch to a customer and pop out under your pant leg..... whats even worse is when bolth of them pop off and slide out under your pant leg in the middle of a meeting. If they would redesign the clip with a locking rod on the top this would not happen, but the clip is only a spring clamp.

I do use these just about every day but don't expect them to hold up out of the box.
summary: It takes work to learn how to use these successsfully, Its worth it though.

It doesn't matter what I do, these shirt stays keep my shirt perfectly tucked into my pants at all times. Not only is it convenient, but I feel more professional as well. reviewText:
These things work really well. I can sit, bend over, jump, twist at work and my dress shirts never come out of being tucked in. I used to hate retucking my shirt all the time and after a while, it looks terrible.

The only reason why I gave it 3 stars is that after 2 weeks, one of the alligator clips stopped clamping tightly so that it would always fall off unless I rolled up my shirt and shoved it into the alligator clip that was loose. Will come back and change review if I get new ones where all the clips work. Sometimes it still falls out if I don't shove enough fabric in the flawed clamp and when one of these detaches, youll feel it walking around, like a piece of metal scraping your leg. Also, since these loop around the front of your foot and you clip the alligators as a Y on the side of your shirt, the stretchy string chaffs with the calf of your leg. I am not that hairy, but I noticed that a lot of leg hair was being chaffed off and irritated/fabric burn that I stopped using them after 3 days straight to relieve the fabric burn. If you get the ones that are truly Y shaped with 3 clips and clip to your sock and not loop around your foot you avoid this fabric burn problem. Some people might only use this twice a week so in that case it probably will be fine.

This product is also bad for people that have to use the bathroom a lot because it takes time to take these off and put back on, but that doesn't factor into my rating.

reviewText: This product definitely does not fail when it comes to keeping your shirt down throughout your work day. First, make sure when you are clipping in your shirt, to make sure the teeth of the clip are on both sides of the shirt.  It is very easy to miss the teeth and clip on the metal side- this will lead you to think that the clip doesn't hold, but of course, that is not the case.  My next recommendation is to spread the Y clips as far as they can go, that way the shirt is not bunched up in several places.  Lastly, I recommend to loosen the straps until you feel comfortable.  You do not want it pulling down on your shirt so tight that the shirt starts to choke your neck.  The first picture of my shirt tucked in is without the product, the second picture of my shirt tucked in is with the product.  My pictures below show how the product was package, the items contained, and the functionality of it.  You honestly have to see it in person to notice the difference.  I cannot wait to wear this product to the wedding I am going to this weekend.  I definitely recommend this product!

I received the Buttons & Pleats Shirt Stays quickly from the seller and they showed up in professional looking packaging.

I have used several types of shirt stays in the past and none of them seemed to be as well made as these right out of the box.  The first thing I noticed was the quality of the straps.  They are a much thicker material than my previous stays.  Additionally, the clips are much better than the usual types that you have to try to loop the shirt over and slip into the metal piece.  Those that have used military shirt stays know what I am talking about.  These are simply clips that clip to your shirt.

Once you clip the straps to your shirt, you just loop the straps around your foot and you are good.  Bear in mind, these will not keep your socks up like the traditional shirt stays.  These are actually more comfortable.  Additionally, there is a plastic buckle about half way up that allows you to adjust the length of the straps and to tighten or loosen the straps at will.

Overall, I am impressed with this product and will continue to use them to see how durable they are.

reviewText: Product came on time, and packaging was in excellent condition. These worked very well on dress shirts, and I'm pregnant worked very well on non maternity shirts. I definitely recommend this product, I'm so glad I got them.

I received these to test and review. Beforehand, I'd never heard about anything like this. However, I'd consistently had issues with shirts coming untucked after car and plane rides, which quickly becomes a major annoyance.

My main worry about this would be that the clamps wouldn't stick well to socks and shirt ends. However, these clamps are extremely sturdy, with a sort of locking mechanism that keeps them from slipping off of the fabric. They elastic is thick and also very sturdy, so the elastic tension pulls shirts down nicely.

I'd definitely recommend these to anyone who has even minor issues with shirts coming untucked. Definitely worth at least a try.

reviewText: I received this as a promotional item to review:  these do what they say they do, they keep your shirt tucked in and neat.  If you're in a medium-movement occupation it does ok, but there's occasional readjustment required.  They're really good.  The best?  Maybe close.

The buttons and pleats did not come with instructions. That was disappointing and frustrating. I looked again where i purchased online and the 2nd photo had instructions.  I tried them for 2 days, it is a great idea since it holds the shirt when you bend over and your pant tend to show your butt. The product was somewhat uncomfortable to wear but gets the job done. I received the buttons and pleats for free to test and give an honest opinion about my experience.

These are well built but they honestly aren't worth the time and effort of putting them on and taking them off. They also don't come with instructions so its kind of hard to know what to do with them.

UPDATE 10/20/15:
I noticed over the past few weeks one of my clips was starting to fail.  I was disappointed, considering these were $20.  I contacted Buttons & Pleats through Amazon to ask for a replacement.  They responded very quickly and said they would send another set out.  They also said:  " please be aware that cheap shirt stays can be lasted for less than 1 month, our product are designed to be last for 2-3 months.
 That mean it is normal to purchase new pack every 3 months."

If you look above at the description of the product it says:  "SURE GRIP CLIPS - Nylon teeth keep a tight hold on your clothing, ensuring a no-fail grip." and "Made to stand the test of time, the BUTTONS & PLEATS Shirt Stays are a solution that you can count on to keep your shirt tucked in."

- The grip has failed on me after 2 months.
-2 months is not what any reasonable person would consider to be the "test of time."

If the manufacturer was more transparent that these are disposable and need frequent replacement, it would have played a role in my decision whether to drop $20 on them.  I really like what they do until they stop doing it.

Original Review:
This review is for the foot loop style.  The clips work great and hold your shirt in place all day.  I was concerned about the elastic being noticeable when seated but it hasn't been an issue.

The one BIG problem that I couldn't deal with were the buckles.  When sitting at my desk or driving (I commute about 40 minutes to work, each way, every day), the plastic buckles dug into the side of my right thigh and were painfully uncomfortable.  Just for reference, I'm not a huge guy.  I'm about 5'7" and 195 lbs.  I ended up removing the buckles and sewing the top and bottom section together at the right length for me and it's significantly more comfortable.  I wouldn't have been able to wear them out of the box, long term.
summary: Clips are great until they fail after 2 months, buckles dig into my legs

reviewText:
I got these as a gift for my boyfriend who had asked for "fun socks". I got these and sadly was very disappointed.

Firstly, although I cannot point you to the set I bought - it seems to no longer be offered - the images show three of the 8 pairs with what looks like red. In reality it is bright pink. The boyfriend likes pink but doesn't want to wear it. I know monitors can show different things to different users but a bunch of pink socks when not expecting them is a disappointment.

Secondly, I bought socks that fit mens shoes sizes 7-12. The socks looked a little on the small side but okay. Then I washed them on cold and tumbled on low heat with a moisture sensor. I am very careful with clothes to keep them nicer for longer, but these socks shrank BIG TIME. These men's shoe size 7-12 do not fit my bf, who wears a 10.5-11. They fit me. I mean perfectly fit me without a stitch of bagginess or extra give. I wear a boy's size 5.5.

So, basically I now have a bunch of socks I wouldn't have picked for me. A bunch of pink men's patterned socks. Oh well, I guess I can wear them around the house and not care about padding outside in them when it's cold to do laundry in the garage or get the dogs inside.

The quality - aside from the radical shrinking and color inaccuracy is pretty nice. The socks are well sewn - or knitted? - and haven't fallen apart or give the impression that they will do so. The patterns are well-rendered. Just don't bank on these being men's sized socks. And if they don't look really big enough - like maybe too big - don't wash them - return them. I should have done this, but alas, I wasn't thinking they would shrink so darned badly. Oh well. You live and learn.

Note: I've added some pics of my 5.5 size (that's the size I fit in boys - I am a ladies size 7.5) next to my boyfriend's boot that is under the size of the largest size these socks are supposed to fit by 1- 1.5 sizes (he wears mens 10.5 or 11 depending) to show the size issue and another close up to show how perfectly snug and comfy these are on my comparatively little feet. Hope this helps and best of luck, all!
summary: "Mens 7-12 shoe size" fits my ladies feet that wear Boy's 5.5

The remaining three pairs are difficult to get on over my heel, and are even more ornery to remove. That's why I rated the fit as "somewhat small". I don't see those three lasting a month.

Aside from that, I am fairly unimpressed. The material isn't thin, exactly, but the socks I bought at Walmart for two bucks a pair feel far more luxurious.

On the positive side, the design is sewn in with different colored threads. So the patterns are going to last. On the negative side, there is a lot of extraneous thread on the inside. I envision a lot of the threads getting caught in toenails as I slide them on.

Overall, I'd say they're decent, but I won't buy them again.

Great. Gorgeous. Bought them as a gift and everyone wanted them.

They are a Chinese product, and the Chinese are usually a little flattering when they guess how big and fat we Westerners are, so you never know if it will fit you, or if you'll have to hand it down to your niece, or if she will have to hand it down to her doll. My American lady feet are an impressive size 10, so I hoped that these socks would be my equivalent. I also hoped that the images wouldn't look like a copy of a copy of the picture was stamped on the socks upside down and sideways, and that they wouldn't be thin enough to use as cheesecloths, and that they wouldn't be so narrow and rigid that my heel would be stuck outside like Winnie the Pooh. But, these socks had none of the flaws I anticipated. And they're actually ...pretty nice. I feel special when I wear them. People stop me and they say, 'hey, where'd you get those socks?'. And when I say people, I mean a person did that one time. But still, true story.

reviewText: This is one of the cutest bags! I bought it for myself as an everyday casual carry, but my 18 year old daughter absconded with it immediately & she loves it. Beautiful color and well-fashioned hardware.

I love this bag! The size is large and roomy, and the material is a high quality denim-like cotton. I haven't really tested the water resistant feature, so I can't speak to that. But I can say this a really well-made bag. The stitching is tight and even, no missed stitches and the stitching doesn't stray from the material. The handles feel like durable leather-like PU leather, but I can't find anything that states what they are actually made of. The graffiti design is not raised, it's like an iron-on but no sign of peeling or cracking.
I have used this bag for several days now, and I am hard on the bags I use. I haven't given this bag an easy test, and it stands up to everything. I have a ton of stuff crammed into it, and there's room for more. I think you could easily fit a tablet or small laptop in it. I have carried my Kindle Fire and Kindle Paperwhite in it, and the bag is so roomy that I have actually had to dig to find them in there. If you love a big bag, then this is an awesome choice! I'm a purse-aholic and a bag-aholic. I have one entire wardrobe devoted to bags and purses....And this bag is going to be on my "go-to" list for a lot of things.
I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest review. My words and opinions are my own and were in no way influenced by the seller.
